title: Nursing Home Registered Nurse (New RNs can Apply)
description:
**Job Posting: Registered Nurse (RN) - Long Term Care/Nursing Home**  
**Location:** Riverdale, Bronx, NY  
**Position Type:** Full-Time  
**Schedule:** Monday-Friday, Rotating Weekends

* Day Shift: 7:00 AM - 3:00 PM
* Night Shift: 3:00 PM - 11:00 PM
* **Compensation:**
* $55.32/hour

**Job Overview:**  
We are seeking compassionate and motivated **Registered Nurses (RNs)** to join our long-term care facility in Riverdale, Bronx, NY. This is a great opportunity for new graduates or experienced RNs looking to make a difference in the lives of our elderly residents. Full training will be provided to ensure your success and growth in the role.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide high-quality nursing care to residents in a long-term care setting.
* Monitor and assess the health of residents, including taking vital signs and administering medications.
* Assist in developing, implementing, and evaluating individualized care plans for residents.
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams, including physicians, therapists, and social workers, to ensure comprehensive care.
* Ensure proper documentation of resident care, progress notes, and any changes in condition.
* Maintain a clean, safe, and supportive environment for residents and staff.
* Provide emotional support and education to residents and their families.
* Adhere to facility policies, procedures, and regulatory standards.

**Qualifications:**

* New graduate nurses are encouraged to apply—training will be provided!
* Active New York State RN license.
* Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work well in a team and provide compassionate, patient-centered care.
* Willingness to work rotating shifts, including weekends.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage of $55.32.
* Comprehensive training program for new graduates and ongoing support.
* Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance.
* Paid Time Off (PTO).
* 401K retirement plan with employer contribution.
* Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $55.00 - $55.32 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Security Officer
description:
A Base Officer for The Soho Grand Hotel has excellent communication and guest service skills, along with the responsibility of protecting the life and safety of all hotel occupants, protecting the physical premises, guest and team member property, as well as the business assets and reputation of the company. A hotel Base Officer at must possess a valid security guard license in the state of New York, an FDNY-issued Fire & Life Safety Director certificate of fitness, and certification in the use of emergency life-saving measures: CPR, use of an Automated External Defibrillator, and First Aid. Base Officers must be prepared to respond to a wide range of emergency situations while exercising competence, professionalism, responsibility, maturity, and hospitality. A Base Officer possesses excellent written and verbal communication skills, and is proficient with standard office technology and equipment. A Base Officer is attentive to detail, diligent to following established policies and procedures, accountable to follow-up and follow-through until a task is complete, and provides a professional customer service experience to all hotel guests and patrons. A Base Officer conducts effective recordkeeping and access control measures. A Base Officer assists as needed in resolving guest incidents and concerns. A Base Officer understands the importance of communication and communicates mission-critical information in a timely and effective manner. To be a successful Base Officer, you must have a neat appearance and an engaging, friendly personality.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITES

* Respond to, investigate and report all security incidents
* Monitor CCTV surveillance for suspicious or concerning activity
* Document reports concerning security incidents; obtain physical evidence and supporting information
* Communicate emergency situations and safety hazards to management
* Conduct/assist with evacuation measures during an emergency
* Request and coordinate emergency medical services when needed
* Perform first aid for guest and team member injuries
* Conduct and document routine fire and life safety tests and inspections
* Patrol building premises and monitor security & life safety systems
* Conduct physical access control and visitor identification/verification
* Conduct team member key fob and RFID access card control
* Issue and document issuance of team member keys, radios, equipment, paychecks, and MetroCards.
* Manage package/parcel deliveries and lost and found
* Provide professional customer service to hotel guests and patrons
* Handle and respond to telephone and email inquiries
* Conduct necessary maintenance of door locks and guest room safes
* Assist with VIP security and privacy, event security, and contractor access-control needs and functions

REQUIREMENTS

* **Flexible schedule, with the ability to work Overnights, on weekends, holidays, and all shifts as needed (required**)
* Valid New York State Security Guard License (required upon hire)
* FDNY Fire & Life Safety Director Certification (F89, T89, or F85 – required upon hire)
* CPR/AED/First Aid certification (required or attained at hire)
* At least 6 months of experience in hospitality, housing, or facility security
* Excellent written and verbal command of English language
* Excellent customer service skills
* Computer literate, proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and standard office technology and equipment
* Experience with Micros Opera and/or ALICE a plus
* Experience with Saflok, Vingcard, MS-Shift, Win-Pak systems a plus
* FDNY City Wide Fire Guard (F01) Certification a plus
* FDNY Sprinkler/Standpipe Inspection (S12/S13) Certification a plus
* FDNY Supervision of Fire Panel (S95) Certification a plus
* FDNY Public Assembly Safety Personnel (F03) Certification plus
* FDNY Fire Drill Conductor (F07) Certification a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.70 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Shift Leader
description:
OUR STORY

Our story starts knee-deep in a huge pile of chickpeas in NYC’s West Village, where we open-door first tiny kitchen

— bringing the vibrant, fresh flavors of the Mediterranean to the city. Now ,we’re all over NY and beyond, from

New Jersey to Maryland to DC to VA.\\We are committed to making everything from scratch and using the best

ingredients: market-fresh produce and 18 different Mediterranean herbs and spices to take your taste buds on a trip

with every meal. Every day, the taim kitchen prepares our award-winning dishes from real food– no microwaves or

freezers— making every meal to order just how you want it.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Taim is growing—and fast! We’re on the lookout for people who love food and hospitality to join our amazing,

passionate team. We will train you to be confident in any station you work – cook, cashier, prep or management. We

will give you a clear path to leadership roles within the company and support your learning so that as we grow, so

does your career. We’re committed to creating an open and inclusive culture where you’ll learn new skills, make an

impact, and be valued for what you do. We don’t just say it, we really encourage our teammates to live our values:

think like an owner, act like family, be curious, stay curious, and most importantly— have a blast doing it.

Sound up your alley? Apply below!

KEY BENFITS

Competitive pay with tips

Get paid immediately after every shift - with no wait or extra cost

Career Growth; Management Training (80% of our managers are promoted from within)

Insurance – medical, dental, vision

Commuter benefits – pretax commuter and parking benefits

Paid vacation and sick days

Major holidays closure

Referral program

Employee reward program – earn gift cards for attendance, trivia and contests

A wonderful culture

YOU WILL BRING

Passion for food and customer service

Ability to develop positive working relationships with the entire team

Ability to be solution oriented with a passion and desire to uphold the ideal taim

experience

Ability to speak clearly and listen attentively to customers and coworkers

Ability to demonstrate a complete understanding of the menu

Ability to speak, read, and understand English

Taim is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. We want to hire exceptional individuals and

foster a culture that champions diversity, ensures equity, and celebrates inclusion. All qualified applicants, regardless

of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply.

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

title: Bilingual Retail Sales Consultant
description:
**Do you like helping people? Do you have a strong desire to connect people with each other through technology and entertainment? You may have what it takes to join our team.**

**Sharing your knowledge with our growing customer base comes with many rewards.**

* **Start with the paycheck – base plus commission.**

**You’ll also gain an amazing benefits package, including:**

* Virtual or in-person employee orientation & ongoing paid training
* Exciting career paths

**Not to mention some pretty cool perks, like:**

* Discounts on accessories and additional AT&T products and services. That means you always have access to the coolest gadgets around.
* Using our technology, gain first-hand expertise to share with our customers.
* Monthly clothing gear reimbursement. You’ll receive a welcome kit of fun gear to get you started (including 2 shirts), as well as any required personal protective equipment (PPE).

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

As a Retail Sales Consultant, you’ll be the face of AT&T, providing personalized interactions with our customers. You’ll deliver excellent customer service while being courteous and knowledgeable of the full suite of AT&T products and services. Being courteous takes on new meaning in today’s environment – it is more than just service with a smile. It is creating a meaningful connection between each customer and our brand. Your ability to provide an effortless experience will be rewarded as you work to meet key objectives and sales goals.

Every day will provide a new set of opportunities, so you’ll need to be flexible and open to change. Depending on your location, you may assist with curbside delivery, online orders or even prospecting efforts to attain new customers. You’ll also assist with maintaining store inventory, basic sanitizing procedures and the merchandising of products. While prior retail or customer-facing sales experience is a plus, we’ll provide training to bring you up to speed!

Ideal candidates will have experience working with infant, toddlers and/or preschool age children, particularly in settings that uphold best Montessori practices.

- Substitute teachers work as needed when a permanent teacher is absent. Often substitutes teachers are called to work several days a week, and sometimes daily. - Responsibilities include care of the environment to ensure the classroom is kept clean and orderly. Daily tasks may include: cleaning, laundry, changing diapers

title: Medical Assistant
description:
Established multi-specialty medical practice is seeking a full-time experienced medical assistant who believes in outstanding patient experience and exhibits compassionate and excellent service core values. This position is for our Primary Care office located in Ridgewood, Queens, NY. This position will rotate as needed throughout our locations.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provides excellent customer service when working with patients that represents PCMH standards.
* Assist with stocking medical supplies daily.
* Organizes patient flow, advises patients of delays or wait times, and accompany the patient to the exam room.
* Document patient's vital signs, medical history and chief complaint in EMR.
* Performs venipuncture on patients as directed by the physician following medical group practice protocols related to safety and infection control.
* Performs tests within the scope of their practice (i.e., EKG, eye tests).
* All other related clerical duties as assigned by supervisor.

**Work Experience:**

* 2-4 years’ work experience in a medical office necessary.
* Prior experience with an EMR system needed.
* Working knowledge of insurance companies.
* Knowledge of medical terminology needed.

**Requirements and Skills:**

* Proven experience as a medical assistant.
* Experience with phlebotomy.
* Experienced with DOT protocol.
* Comfortable working with forms, applications, and confidential information.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel, Google Docs and Sheets.
* Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Must exhibit critical thinking skills and organizational skills.
* High degree of attention to detail and trustworthiness.
* Background working in a busy physician office preferred.

**Education and Credentials:**

* High school diploma/GED required
* College Associate’s degree a plus

title: Physical Therapy Technician
description:
**Job Title: Physical Therapy Tech**

**Location:** Monroe, NJ

**Department:** Orthopedic Outpatient Clinic

**Reports To:** Physical Therapist/Clinic Manager

**Job Summary:**

The Physical Therapy Tech supports physical therapists in delivering high-quality care to patients in an orthopedic outpatient setting. The role involves assisting with patient treatments, maintaining equipment, and ensuring a smooth flow of daily operations in the clinic.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Patient Assistance:**
* Assist physical therapists with patient evaluations and treatments.
* Prepare patients for therapy sessions, including setting up modalities and ensuring patients are comfortable.
* **Equipment Maintenance:**
* Clean, sanitize, and organize therapy equipment and treatment areas.
* Report any equipment malfunctions or needs for repair to the appropriate personnel.
* **Patient Communication:**
* Provide excellent customer service by greeting patients and addressing their inquiries.
* Educate patients on home exercise programs and proper use of therapy equipment.
* **Clinic Operations:**
* Ensure the clinic environment is clean, safe, and well-organized.
* Assist with inventory management, including ordering and restocking supplies.
* **Compliance:**
* Adhere to clinic policies and procedures, as well as regulatory requirements and standards.
* Maintain patient confidentiality and ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education and Experience:**
* High school diploma or equivalent required; some college coursework in health sciences or a related field preferred.
* Previous experience in a physical therapy or healthcare setting is desirable.
* **Skills and Abilities:**
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team and independently.
* Proficiency in using office equipment and electronic health record (EHR) systems.
* Knowledge of basic anatomy and orthopedic conditions is a plus.
* **Physical Requirements:**
* Ability to lift and move patients or equipment as necessary.
* Capability to stand, walk, and perform physical tasks for extended periods.

**Working Conditions:**

* Full-time position with potential for occasional overtime.
* Standard office and clinical environment.

title: Program Associate
description:
**Overview**  
The Mayor's Fund to Advance New York City is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization working with more than 30 City agencies and offices, 300 institutional funders, and 100 community-based partners. The Mayor's Fund and its partners advance initiatives that improve the lives of New Yorkers from all walks of life and across all five boroughs.

Established in 1994 (formerly Public-Private Initiatives), the organization has grown to become an important vehicle for foundations, corporations and individuals to contribute to programs that enhance the lives of New Yorkers. In particular, the Mayor's Fund has made strategic investments to promote mental health services for all New Yorkers, increase workforce development opportunities for young New Yorkers, and meet the needs of New York City's diverse immigrant community.

**The Position**  
-Reporting to the Director of Programs, the Programs and Policy Associate will manage a portfolio of City agency programs with Mayor’s Fund investment to ensure programmatic effectiveness, efficiency, and compliance.

**The positions requires that the Programs and Policy Associate:** 

* Facilitate meetings with City Agency partners and donors.
* Assist with contracts, development, and program management.
* Manage the Mayor’s Fund general email inbox daily.
* Prepare payment authorization forms with supporting documentation for payment processing on a weekly basis
* Provide general ledgers to agency partners each month.
* Draft the Mayor’s Fund Weekly report template for the team
* Support the senior team with various administrative tasks

**Experience**  
The successful candidate will join a fast-paced environment with an opportunity to build meaningful and long-lasting public-private partnerships for the benefit of all New Yorkers.

The candidate should have the following:

* Commitment to the advancement of New York City.
* Minimum of three (3) years of work experience in program management, public policy, grants management, or a similar area.
* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Excellent project management skills with an ability to manage multiple projects at once.
* Superior writing skills and attention to detail.
* Demonstrated commitment to public interest, philanthropy, or social entrepreneurship.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $68,500.00 per year

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10007

* General knowledge of coaching techniques and procedures.
* Demonstrated ability to instruct, lead and supervise student athletes
* Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills

**Hours:**

* Daily practices Monday-Friday after school.
* 6 Meets plus Division, Conference, State and Invitational Meets
* Possible Weekend Meets

**Compensation:** Pursuant to the iLearn Coaching Salary Scale

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES**

**This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees may be required to follow other job-related instructions and to perform other job-related duties as requested, subject to all applicable state and federal laws. Certain job functions described herein may be subject to possible modification in accordance with applicable state and federal laws.**

* iLearn Schools expects Varsity Head coaches to assume responsibility for the entire program which includes:
* Coaching the varsity team and supervising JV & assistant coaches within the program.
* Giving guidance to the high school junior varsity and middle school program.
* Implementing district, league, conference and state athletic department policies.
* Assists in the selection and evaluation of Junior Varsity and assistant coaching staff.
* Works with the High School Athletic Director and Principal to
* Communicate the bowling practice, match, and bus schedule
* Verify student physical examination requirements.
* Prepare athletic permission slips and eligibility lists such as grade checks.
* Organize middle school communications of the high school program for incoming freshmen.
* Develop programs in the elementary and middle school to foster interest and development in the sport.
* Supervises practice areas and playing areas during and following periods of team participation.
* Remains with students and supervises them while traveling to away competitions.
* Works closely with the Athletic Trainer to care for athletes and injured players. Communicates all injuries to the Athletic Trainer and parents as necessary.
* Cares for, takes inventory and maintains the distribution and storage of all necessary equipment and uniforms.
* Plans and coordinates the end of the year Team Banquet or Dinner.
* Organizes at least one team fundraiser and participates in all Athletic Department and Booster Club fundraisers as necessary.
* Organizes at least one outreach event to the elementary school, middle school or community at large;
* Clinics, camps, school visits, invites to varsity games or practice etc.
* Attends all state, division, and conference meetings where the program is involved.
* Is informed on current trends in the sport and attends and clinics and professional development.
* Maintains active membership in related professional organizations and associations.
* Maintains a positive staff relationship with other coaches.
* Dresses professionally relative to their sport.
* Communicates with players about personal development during the season as well as the off-season by providing player improvement forms and individual meetings.
* Provides and communicates opportunities for players to better themselves in the offseason such as:
* Offseason workouts
* Weight room access
* Sharing information on camps and clinics
* Holds meetings with parents to inform them about the program as well as your expectations of them and the players.
* Leads by example regarding promotion of sportsmanship.
* Promotes the high school program by encouraging participation of players of the upcoming season.
* Performs other duties as assigned by the High School Principal and Athletic Director.
* Applies and enforces student discipline during athletic contests, practice sessions, and while on trips off school property in accordance with Student Code of Conduct and student handbook.
* Advises students and parents on athletic code of conduct, including consequences for violation, and coordinates with athletic director in instances of possible violations of the code of conduct.
* Establish and maintain open, professional and respectful communications with students, parents, teachers, athletic director and youth feeder coaches.
* Have the total athletic and school program at interest. Be supportive of student participation in other student activities and communicate with colleagues regarding expectations in and out of season.

Job Types: Contract, Seasonal

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

* Weekends as needed

* AED Certification (Required)

title: Territory Sales Manager
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a results-driven Territory Sales Manager (TSM) to join our team. The TSM will serve as a key representative for one of Azend Pharma’s clients, a specialty pharmacy, within the designated territory. In this role, you will be marketing your pharmacy’s services to healthcare providers. You will be responsible for executing innovative sales strategies aimed at driving pharmacy growth and maximizing client satisfaction.

You will be responsible for establishing the specialty pharmacy as the preferred pharmacy of choice by identifying opportunities to support prescribers and their patients through a consultative and relationship-based approach. TSM will act as a liaison between medical practices and the pharmacy.

**Important Note:** This is strictly an in-person role. Candidates must be physically present in the field and not working remotely or in a hybrid capacity.

**Responsibilities:**

· Develop a comprehensive understanding of the healthcare market, pharmacy operations, prescriber workflows, and specialty pharmacy services.

· Achieve sales growth through creating new and maintaining existing prescriber relationships.

· Pre-call planning to ensure an organized workflow and effective sales techniques.

· Document calls and notes in our CRM, and complete strategic planning reports.

**Qualifications:**

· One year of healthcare or related sales experience preferred.

· Strong communications and presentation skills with a competitive desire to succeed.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

· Applicant must have a valid US driver's license and car for travel and driving record in compliance with company standards.

· Candidate must live within 25 miles of territory.

title: Installation Support Technician (Cabling Experience Required)
description:
Temporary for 28.2 weeks of work starting on 10/7.

Job Type: Full-Time/Contract

Job Summary: We are seeking a reliable and skilled Installation Support Technician with experience in cabling and basic IT support tasks. The ideal candidate will be responsible for installing and troubleshooting network/PC infrastructure, including running CAT 5 and CAT 6 cables, drilling and mounting speakers, and installing network components. This position requires working on ladders and providing your own tools.

Key Responsibilities:

* Cabling: Run, terminate, and test CAT 5 and CAT 6 cables according to industry standards.
* Hardware Installation: Install and configure network and PC type hardware.
* Drilling and Mounting: Drill and securely mount speakers and other equipment as required.
* Ladder Work: Safely work on ladders to install and maintain equipment at heights.
* Basic IT Support: Provide hands-on support for hardware troubleshooting, replacements, and other support tasks as needed.
* Documentation: Maintain accurate records of work performed, including cable runs, installations, and troubleshooting steps.
* Safety Compliance: Follow all safety protocols and procedures to ensure a safe working environment.

Qualifications:

* Experience: Proven experience in running CAT 5 and CAT 6 cables, and installing network hardware.
* Tools: Must provide own tools.
* Physical Requirements: Ability to work on ladders and over head
* Technical Skills: Basic understanding of network and PC install. Audio experience is helpful.
* Problem-Solving: Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to work independently and efficiently.
* Communication: Good communication skills to interact with team members and clients.
* Safety Awareness: Knowledge of safety practices related to working with electrical equipment, ladders, and power tools.

Required Tools:

* Ladder capable of reaching 10’ ceilings but as low as 6'.
* Basic hand tools
* Smart phone
* Flash light – not the one on the phone
* Glow sticks
* Fish tape
* Electrical tape
* Impact driver
* Cordless drill
* Various sizes of wood, metal and masonry drill bits
* Various sizes and types of driver bits
* Ethernet cable tester that displays output of all 8 pins simultaneous
* Cable toner
* 1” spade bit (in addition to the bits mentioned above)
* 1” masonry bit (in addition to the bits mentioned above)
* Velcro
* RJ 45 Crimper
* Tin Snips

Preferred Qualifications:

* Certifications such as CompTIA Network+, etc
* Previous experience in a similar hands-on IT support role.

title: Water/Waste Water Estimator - Construction Projects - Remote
description:
Arcadis is seeking a Water/Waste Water estimator to join our Places Infrastructure business. This position is remote and can performed anywhere in the United States.


Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets.


We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.


**POSITION - WATER/WASTE WATER ESTIMATOR - CONSTRUCTION**

**LOCATION - REMOTE ROLE**

**Role description:**

You will manage the delivery of detailed and accurate estimates for a range of construction projects for Arcadis. Supporting all aspects of the estimating process with the oversite of the Project Management Team. The successful candidate should be able to work independently while maintaining strong relationships, cohesion, and transparency with the project team at large and external project Teams.


**Role accountabilities:**

* Prepare and/or coordinate the preparation of estimates and reports as requested by the Project Manager and/or client; includes the collection of necessary cost data for conceptual and/or take-off estimating,
* Prepare estimating procedures and overall estimating review and justification
* Support Project Controls team in decision making
* Work within established financial systems and budgets to produce reports and forecasts and track budgets, overseeing costing and variances to manage and control cost variables,
* Complete technical assignments of focused scope and increasing level of difficulty,
* Act as a project resource, completing allocated activities to meet budget, timeframe and quality objectives and meeting or exceeding client expectations,
* Carry out investigations and analyses to support the development of technical solutions,
* Prepare documentation and reports ensuring accuracy and compliance with Arcadis requirements and relevant national standards and codes of practice,
* Liaise with Project Managers/Team Leaders and clients to ensure effective communication on project matters,
* Contribute to the resolution of technical issues on projects and provide technical guidance to other team members,
* Collaborate with other design disciplines to ensure the integrity of the overall design or solution,
* Review completed engineering work to ensure it meets specified standards,
* Build valued relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure client satisfaction, develop the cost management service and create new business opportunities

**Key Skills & Attributes:**

* Possess complex technical knowledge of water and waste water processes
* Preferred NYC DEP experience and have knowledge of other agencies in the Tri-State area such as NYC DDC, NYPA, EDC, NYCHA etc.
* Deep market knowledge especially in the New York area
* Be able to read and interpret civil, process mechanical, structural, architectural, and MEP construction plans and related documents like, but not limited to: contacts, technical specifications, etc.
* Be able to prepare cost estimates and associated basis of estimate reports throughout the life of the projects, from planning, design, and through the construction phase
* Experienced accessing and working with risk management
* Deep technical knowledge working with range of project software like: Sage, Bluebeam, ProEst, Other Estimating Software as well as MS Office and MS Teams
* Strong builder of external Team relationships with a history of turning relationships into new business opportunities
* Be a collaborative partner with internal Teams
* Commitment to health and safety
* Strong communication skills – verbal and written

**Qualifications & Experience:** 

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline (Engineering, Construction Management, Quantity Surveying)
* Relevant professional certification (i.e., CCP, CEP, CPE, MRICS or similar)
* 8 or more years’ relevant experience related to new or rehabilitation of water/wastewater infrastructure
* Relevant professional experience in a similar working environment
* Experience working with people and demonstration of leadership skills, including the ability to motivate others
* Experience building and managing relationships with internal and external Teams, including the ability to act as a trusted advisor

Why Arcadis?


We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.


Together, we can create a lasting legacy.


Join Arcadis. Create a Legacy.


Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging


We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Women, minorities, people with disabilities and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


Arcadis offers benefits for full time and part time positions. These benefits include medical, dental, and vision, EAP, 401K, STD, LTD, AD&D, life insurance, paid parental leave, reward & recognition program and optional benefits including wellbeing benefits, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement. We offer nine paid holidays and 15 days PTO that accrue per year. The salary range for this position is $112,240 to $168,360 year. Actual salaries will vary and are based on several factors, such as experience, education, budget, internal equity, project and location.

title: Environmental Services Aide
description:
**WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:**

A friendly and compassionate Environmental Services Aide! As an Environmental Services Aide at St. Johnland, you will play a vital role in maintaining the cleanliness of our facility, helping to maintain a safe environment for our residents, visitors, and staff, adhering to infection control policies and all safety protocols. If you have a passion for eldercare and an eye for detail, please apply!

**Responsibilities include:**

* Daily dusting, sweeping vacuuming, and mopping of floors
* Polishing furniture
* Cleaning restrooms and trash removal
* Disinfecting all areas as scheduled
* Laundry services as needed – Assist in processing resident clothing and linen distribution
* *May also provide assistance to grounds department during inclement weather*

**WHAT YOU NEED:**   
*(Requirements/Qualifications)*

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. and stand for long periods
* Frequent bending and walking required
* Experience in long term care preferred
* Experience in floor care preferred, but not required
* One year of similar cleaning experience preferred
* Commitment to providing exceptional care and service to our residents

**WHO WE ARE:**

St. Johnland Nursing and Rehab, founded in 1872, is a non-profit skilled nursing facility dedicated to providing exceptional care and compassion to our residents. We are a 250-bed facility and premier provider for skilled nursing care. Our specialties include Alzheimer’s/Dementia, head injury rehabilitation, long-term care, and subacute care. Our rich history and commitment to excellence has made us a trusted name in the community.

*You can learn more about us and our other openings at:* https://stjohnland.org/

**At St. Johnland, we offer:**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Paid Time Off
* Tuition Reimbursement
* 401(k) with Employer Match!
* Life Insurance

*We are an equal opportunity employer.*

To plan, organize and implement an appropriate instructional program in a learning environment that guides and encourages students to develop and fulfill their academic potential.

title: Property and Casualty Underwriting Associate
description:
Position Summary
The Property and Casualty Underwriting Associate is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of existing policy information for renewals, communicating effectively with clients for information gathering, and supporting the underwriting process through precise documentation. The role conducts risk assessments and audits for insurance applications, calculates premium and generates reports. They ensure strict adherence to company policies, industry regulations, and compliance standards in all underwriting activities.
What will your job entail?
Responsibilities:
Evaluates and maintains existing policy information to ensure data is current, accurate, and appropriately priced for renewal.
Responds to client requests and questions, offering information and advice regarding the insurance products & underwriting appetite.
Communicates with clients to gather necessary information, resolves inquiries, and ensures a smooth underwriting process.
Prepares and organizes documentation related to underwriting submissions and policy issuance.
Assesses risks associated with individual insurance applications, considering both standard and substandard criteria.
Provides support in premium calculations, ensuring accurate application of rates based on underwriting guidelines.
Builds and maintains reports on underwriting activities, key performance indicators, and relevant metrics.
Conducts internal and external audits by providing necessary documentation and information related to underwriting activities.
Ensures adherence to company policies, guidelines, industry regulations, and compliance standards in underwriting activities.
Collaborates with underwriting teams to relay information, coordinate tasks, and contribute to the overall underwriting process.
Serves as the key point of contact for customers and agents and delivers excellent customer service by addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring a positive experience for them.
Work Experience:
Minimum of 1 year of experience in Property and Casualty Underwriting with a Bachelor’s degree.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree required; Risk Management, Actuarial and Business Administration preferred. Any other related discipline or commensurate work experience considered.
Licenses & Certifications:
Prescribed: Minimum requirements for state P&C and/or surplus line licenses.
Preferred: Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter (CPCU)

title: Full Time Nanny needed in Larchmont, NY
description:
Start: ASAP

Age(s) of Child(ren): 2 children – 2- and 4-year-old

Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5pm

Compensation: $25 - $30

Description:

**Full Time Nanny needed in Larchmont**

A loving family of 4 is looking for a full time nanny for their 4 and 2 year old girls! This is a great role for someone with strong knowledge of age-appropriate activities, someone who puts the safety of the children above all and truly loves working with children. Responsibilities include creating fun and age appropriate activities, plan play dates, drop off and pick up, monitoring the child’s growth and development, help prepare dinner and next day's lunch, and help with light cleaning and routing household chores. The position starts ASAP. They are looking for someone who is warm, efficient, and can work with them as a team and become a part of their family.

**Ideal Nanny**

The ideal nanny candidate would embody a blend of professionalism, warmth, and reliability. They would have a sincere passion for childcare, consistently demonstrating patience, creativity, and enthusiasm in their interactions with children. With a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, they would be well-versed in developmental milestones, capable of planning and facilitating activities that promote learning and growth.

Possessing a valid First Aid/CPR certification, the candidate would prioritize safety and be prepared to handle emergencies efficiently. Their references would reflect a history of dependable, compassionate care, and their background check would be clear of any discrepancies. They would be a non-smoker with reliable transportation and a clean driving record, indicative of their dependability. Flexibility is crucial, and the ideal candidate would adapt seamlessly to our changing schedules, showing availability for occasional weekends and a long-term commitment to our family.

**Position Requirements**

● Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional childcare experience.

● Certification: Valid First Aid/CPR certification for infants and children.

● References: Excellent references from previous employers.

● Background Check: Clear background check.

● Communication: Strong communication skills in English.

● Driver’s License: Valid driver's license and clean driving record (for driving positions).

● Age Group Experience: Experience with toddler and pre-school.

● Activity Planning: Ability to plan and engage in developmentally appropriate activities.

● Housekeeping: Willingness to perform light housekeeping related to the children.

● Non-Smoker: Must be a non-smoker.

● Transportation: Reliable transportation.

● Flexibility: Flexibility with hours and availability for occasional weekends.

● Commitment: Ability to commit long term.

**Compensation/Benefits**

● Competitive Pay: $25-$30 per hour

● Benefits: PTO, Sick Days, Federal Holidays +

If you meet the qualifications and are excited about this opportunity, please log in and review your candidate profile. Make sure your profile is complete and up to date with your current position.

title: Debt Settlement Specialist

Our team is passionate about providing effective debt settlement solutions and exceptional customer service. As we expand our operations, we are seeking experienced Debt Settlement Agents to join our dynamic team in Jersey City—just a stone's throw away from the vibrant energy of Manhattan.

title: Baker
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic Baker to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in food preparation, a love for creating delicious baked goods, and strong work ethic. As a Baker, you will be responsible for producing high-quality pastries and bread, while ensuring that all food safety and handling standards are met.

This role requires creativity, attention to detail, time management, strong communication skills, and the ability to work well in a team setting.

**Duties**  
- Prepare and bake a variety of baked goods including breads, pastries, and cookies.  
- Ensure all food preparation areas are clean and organized in accordance with food safety standards.  
- Collaborate with kitchen staff to create new recipes and improve existing products.  
- Maintain inventory of baking supplies and place orders as needed.

**Qualifications**  
- Proven experience as a Baker or in a similar role within a kitchen environment.  
- Understanding of basic baking techniques and recipes, including bread, pastries, cakes, and cookies  
- Familiarity with food safety regulations and best practices in food handling.  
- Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail.  
- Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well within a team.  
- A passion for baking and creating high-quality products  
- Must have the ability to stand for extended periods of time.  
- Must be able to lift heavy items up to 50 lbs.  
- Must be able to work various shifts, including: early mornings, weekends, and holidays, as needed.

If you believe you have the skills and enthusiasm to excel in this role, we'd love to meet and have you be a part of our growing company!

title: Copywriter
description:
**Company Description**  

We're Heartbeat, the marketing agency for Healthcare Challenger Brands and the brave clients behind them. And hopefully you're our next Copywriter, helping us to deliver game-changing campaigns for Consumers & HCPs.


Read on to learn more about what qualities we're looking for in a new member of the crew and why you're gonna dig working with us.

 **Job Description** **How you’ll strengthen the team:**


Our team is looking for someone who has a winsome attitude and understands the ever-changing digital advertising landscape. Beyond that, here’s how you’ll make your mark:

* Under direction of the creative leadership, conjure & help evolve top-notch marketing copy that realizes campaign & project objectives in engaging and articulate language
* Pay obsessive attention to narrative consistency, voice & tone, as well as accuracy of content (in partnership with Editorial)
* See copy decks and manuscripts through development and to launch (in partnership with Editorial and Creative Director)
* Write, reference, and annotate copy, using AMA or brand style, in preparation for medical/legal review
* Commit to polishing copy details while maintaining broad perspective on narrative flow and editorial voice
* Incorporate internal team feedback and client medical/legal team feedback in a timely fashion under the direction of a Senior Copywriter
* Maintain brand master reference library

**Hell yes, I want to do all of that. But tell me more about Heartbeat…**


Heartbeat is a healthcare marketing & creative agency, headquartered in NYC and powered by ~300 smart people all over the US. In the past four years, we’ve been named a 4-time “Best Place to Work” by *AdAge* and *MM+M* and a “Diversity & Inclusion Champion” by *MedAdNews*.


We care about three big things:

**1. Empowering Challenger Brands**  

We work with marketers who have big mountains to climb and the ambition to make it happen. As their sherpa and sidekicks, we must relentlessly deliver on our core values: insightful, inventive, and courageous.

**2. Being the Best Place You’ll Ever Work**


This isn’t all pool tables and Bagel Fridays — it’s about giving you the support to do and be your best. Examples include the ability to work wherever (forever), unlimited PTO, and self-care stipends. We also love to let loose, whether through selfie scavenger hunts or bouts of companywide bingo that would shock even the rowdiest retirement communities.

**3. Fostering a Diverse & Caring Community**


We’re the most diverse agency in healthcare, by design. No matter your story, you’ll find representation and amplification — through our affinity groups, cultural celebrations, and unwavering support no matter what society throws at us. We’re proud to say that you can be anything you want at Heartbeat (as long as it’s not an a\\*\\*hole).


There’s a reason 1/3 of Heartbeaters have been here for 4+ years and we have a 90% retention rate. We hope you’ll experience it for yourself.

**About Publicis Health & Publicis Groupe**


Heartbeat is a proud member of Publicis Health, the largest health communications network in the world. Publicis Health is one of the four solutions hubs of Publicis Groupe, the third-largest advertising and media company in the world — offering us unparalleled global reach and resources.

 **Qualifications**  

Across 1-3 years of experience, you’ve built a legit foundation in crafting copy. These are the skills you’ve totally nailed:

* Ability to recognize strong creative ideas and see them through to completion
* Thrive under pressure in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to meet deadlines for multiple projects simultaneously
* Exposure to referencing and annotating work
* Track record as a creative problem solver with a knack for fresh ideas and a new perspective
* Experience with writing consumer-focused content
* Pharmaceutical/healthcare marketing writing experience a HUGE plus

  

**Additional Information** *All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.*

*Compensation Range: $64,500- $101,500 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 11/24/2024.*

title: Sales Trainee
description:
Join us as a Sales Trainee and take the first step towards a rewarding career in the RV Industry!

**Overview**  
Rare opportunity to join our company. We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Sales Trainee to join our dynamic sales team. This entry-level position is designed for individuals looking to kickstart their career in sales and gain valuable experience in a fast-paced environment. As a Sales Trainee, you will receive comprehensive training and mentorship to develop your skills in various sales techniques, product knowledge, and customer engagement strategies. Willing to work Saturdays, maintaining a 5-day, 43-hour work week. Benefits, Sick Time & Vacation available and will accrue after your 90-day trial period.

**Responsibilities**

- Participate in training sessions to learn about our products, services, and sales processes.

- Assist in conducting product demonstrations to potential clients.

- Engage with customers through direct sales efforts, including cold calling and inside sales activities.

- Support the sales team in managing accounts and maintaining customer relationships.

- Collaborate with team members to develop effective sales strategies and approaches.

- Learn to negotiate terms and close deals effectively while ensuring customer satisfaction.

- Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and sales activities using software tools.

- Stay updated on industry trends and technology advancements relevant to our products.

**Skills**

- Strong interest in RV Sales and Lifestyle.

- Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage customers effectively.

- Must have a good personality with a positive attitude to join our fun team.

- Basic understanding of sales management principles and account management practices.

- Ability to negotiate confidently and persuasively with clients.

- Familiarity with conducting product demos and presentations.

- Experience or willingness to learn about direct sales techniques, including cold calling strategies.

- Proficiency in using software tools for tracking sales activities and managing customer data.

Pay: $49,995.00 - $100,000.00 per year

title: Mental Health Clinician
description:
Under the supervision of the Clinical Supervisor and the Mental Health Unit Chief in their assigned facility on Rikers Island, the Mental Health Clinician will provide quality mental health care to incarcerated adult men who need and/or want services• Conducts mental health evaluations, crisis intervention, assessments, and follow-up care. Determines and coordinates disposition of patients for appropriate level of mental health care. Coordinates with Reentry Social Workers for appropriate discharge planning services Completes required statistical reports. Collaborates with the Department of Correction to ensure access to patients, proper housing, and treatment disposition. Coordinates patient care with other institutional programs. Develops and leads group treatment on mental health observation units and other units as assigned. Completes all required documentation. Participates in clinical supervision with Clinical Supervisor at least once a week. Participates in mental health and medical rounds as assigned. Participates in case conferences and treatment planning for patients receiving and being considered for mental health treatment. May conduct psychological testing as assigned. May supervise social work interns or student volunteers as assigned. Performs other duties as assigned by Unit Chief, Assistant Unit Chief, and Clinical Supervisor.

**Skills:**Preference given to those applicants with experience conducting both assessment and treatment with adults with behavioral problems, substance use histories and severe mental illness. Preference will also be given to applicants with inpatient or related experience.

title: Administrative Support
description:
**Join Our Heart-Centered Team at Healing Through the Heart Center!**

Are you a **nurturing**, ***compassionate***, ***detail-oriented*** individual looking to make a meaningful impact? In this hybrid admin role, you’ll often be the first point of contact for our clients, embodying our values and creating a welcoming experience. This position is ideal for anyone passionate about supporting both clients and staff in a ***heart-centered*** environment. If you’re eager to be part of a team where your work truly makes a difference, we’d love to hear from you!

**About Us**

At Healing Through the Heart Center, we believe the therapeutic relationship is the heart of our work. As a budding group practice, we are dedicated to putting our clients’ needs, dreams, and progress at the forefront of everything we do.

**Our Vision**

We strive to provide transformative therapy that creates lasting change. Our space is designed for both practitioners and clients to feel safe and empowered on their journey towards authenticity.

**Our Core Values**

* Heart-Centered
* Authenticity
* Integrity
* Passion
* Effective

**Position:** Administrative Support

**Pay:** $20 per hour

**Hours:** Part-time, starting at 5-10 hours per week with the opportunity for growth

**Hybrid Role:** Flexible hours with occasional in-office visits.

**You’ll Report to: Jill Portaro, LCSW & Founder**

**What You’ll Do:**

* Respond to and follow up on all client calls to ensure excellent service.
* Conduct intake procedures to warmly welcome clients into our practice.
* Assist in scheduling appointments and managing client bookings efficiently.
* Handle email correspondence and follow up with clients to address their needs.
* Provide administrative support to therapists, ensuring a smooth and organized workflow.

**Skills & Attributes of our Ideal Candidate**

* 2-3 years of experience in client care or customer service (medical office preferred).
* Dynamic, self-motivated individual with the ability to work independently, proactively and well under pressure
* Strong communication skills with a compassionate approach to client interactions.
* An entrepreneurial mindset that helps you think ahead and see the big picture.
* Confidence in sharing ideas and feedback to help us grow.
* Ability to juggle multiple projects while meeting deadlines.
* Tech-savviness—familiarity with Electronic Health Record (EHR) software (Jane App is a plus) and online tools.

**This role is perfect for those studying psychology, social work, or counseling, providing a great opportunity to grow and learn in a heart-centered environment.**

**Benefits:**

* Flexible working hours
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program

**Application Process:**

If you’re excited about the opportunity to work in a supportive and compassionate environment, please reach out to us directly! Send your resume, cover letter, and the results of the Big 5 personality test to **Admin@ThroughHeartTherapy.com** 

We appreciate all applications, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. For more about our practice, visit our website: **https://throughhearttherapy.com/** 

**We can’t wait to meet someone who shares our passion for nurturing both clients and staff!**

* Customer service: 1 year (Required)

title: Dishwasher
description:
**Requisitos:**  
Tener experiencia como lavaplatos.  
Vivir cerca y llegar facilmente al restaurante.  
No es necesario hablar ingles, pero es beneficial.  
Conocimiento de mantener limpio y sano el restaurante, los banos y la cocina.  
Conocimiento de los jabones y quimicos limpiadores.  
De vez en cuando la noche va hasta o mas de la medianoche. Hay que terminar y limpiar todo antes de salir. El restaurante tiene que estar listo para el dia siguiente.

En este momento el puesto consiste de 3 noches. Normalmente corren las noches desde las 5 hasta last 11 o mas.

Llame al restaurante a las 516-620-0057. Pide Andres. Si no esta, deja tu nombre y telefono. Gracias.

**Overview**  
The Dishwasher plays a crucial role in maintaining the cleanliness and efficiency of our kitchen operations. This position is essential for supporting the culinary team by ensuring that all dishes, utensils, and kitchen equipment are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized. The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and a commitment to maintaining high standards of cleanliness in a fast-paced environment.

**Duties**  
- Wash and sanitize dishes, pots, pans, and utensils using commercial dishwashing equipment.  
- Maintain cleanliness of the dishwashing area and ensure all equipment is in good working order.  
- Assist with food preparation by cleaning and cutting vegetables or other ingredients as needed.  
- Support kitchen staff by bussing tables and removing used dishes from dining areas.  
- Follow proper food handling procedures to ensure safety and hygiene standards are met.  
- Help maintain inventory of cleaning supplies and notify management when supplies need replenishing.  
- Adhere to all health and safety regulations within the kitchen environment.

**Skills**  
- Experience in a kitchen or restaurant setting is preferred, with knowledge of food handling practices.  
- Familiarity with catering operations or hotel environments is a plus.  
- Ability to work efficiently in a team-oriented atmosphere while maintaining a positive attitude.  
- Strong attention to detail with an emphasis on cleanliness and sanitation.  
- Capability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.  
- Basic culinary skills are beneficial but not required; willingness to learn is essential.

Join our team as a Dishwasher and contribute to creating exceptional dining experiences through your dedication to cleanliness and support for our culinary team!

title: Product Development & Compliance Specialist
description:
MSIG North America continues to grow!
Summary/Job Purpose:
The Product Services & Compliance Specialist is responsible for the preparation, creation and maintenance of Property and Casualty products, forms & filings. This includes working with legal to create and maintain coverage forms and endorsements. In addition, you will be responsible for providing training and development to underwriting field staff involving all areas of compliance and form maintenance. You will also work closely with individual line of business staff on all regulatory and bureau changes to rate, rules & forms
Essential Functions:* Ability to develop and implement forms, rule or rate filing (single state filing or a multistate product filing) with minimal management intervention.
* Review, analyze and evaluate ISO, AAIS, NCCI and other rate and form bureaus and suppliers program and rate and rule revisions. Assist in the planning/decision process, and assist in the development of various disclosures and/or company responses necessary for State Compliance and implementation of revised products.
* Update and review/revise underwriting documents and related information on the company’s intranet (Wave), including underwriting guidelines for rating, forms, procedural and authority issues, as well as other instructional/directional material, as assigned.
* Act as a home office resource for field offices as respects rate, rule & filing issue ie: how our products work/how do our forms interact with our policies etc.
* Perform complex coverage issues and provide written explanations and direction
* Coordinate training programs to provide direction to Underwriters, Operations or Producers.
* Participate in special projects at the direction of Underwriting.
* Monitor & prioritize regulatory and compliance workload according to product development department guideline as well as direction of the manager.
* Review regulatory publications to keep apprised of new regulatory developments, and evaluate, respond to and implement as required in conjunction with management direction.
* Participate in underwriting audit process to determine regulatory guidelines are being met. This applies to all lines of business.


Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.
Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience Required:* Bachelor's degree is preferred.
* 5+ years underwriting experience in a multi-line admitted standard lines environment is preferred.
* 5+ years’ product services experience is required.


It's an exciting time for our company and a great opportunity to join a financially sound and growing global insurance group!  

It is the policy of MSIG-NA to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, MSIG-NA will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Medical Receptionist
description:

**Location:** Brick, NJ

**Department:** Physical Therapy Office

**Reports To:** Office Manager/Clinic Director

**Job Summary:**

The Medical Receptionist serves as the first point of contact for patients and visitors in a physical therapy office. This role involves managing front-desk operations, ensuring a welcoming and efficient patient experience, and supporting the clinical staff with administrative tasks.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Patient Interaction:**

* Answer phone calls and route them to appropriate staff or take messages as needed.
* Manage patient records, ensuring they are accurate and up-to-date.
* Process and file medical records, intake forms, and other documents.
* **Office Operations:**
* Maintain a clean and organized reception area.
* Handle office supplies and inventory, placing orders as necessary.
* Assist with other administrative tasks, including data entry and filing.
* **Compliance and Confidentiality:**
* Adhere to clinic policies and procedures, including those related to patient privacy and HIPAA regulations.
* Ensure accurate and secure handling of patient information and documentation.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education and Experience:**
* High school diploma or equivalent required; some college coursework in healthcare or business administration preferred.
* Previous experience in a medical office or customer service role is desirable.
* **Skills and Abilities:**
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Proficiency with office software and electronic health record (EHR) systems.
* Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and maintain patient confidentiality.
* **Personal Attributes:**
* Professional demeanor and positive attitude.
* Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to providing exceptional patient care.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

title: Premium Accounting Representative
description:
MSIG North America continues to grow!
Summary/Job Purpose:
The Premium Accounting Representative is responsible to bill and collect premium dollars and maintain low outstanding receivables for assigned book of business. Identify errors in premium receivables and reconcile them with appropriate areas. Regularly work with producers, branch underwriting, operations and the audit department. Identify collection problems and coordinate resolution with department management, the field and the MSMM representatives. Reconcile and balance cash receipts to bank and general ledger.
Essential Functions:* Reconciles Agency and Direct bill receivables on assigned book of business. Manages Agency and Direct Bill accounts to achieve departmental goals, improve cash flow by proactively reviewing accounts prior to them aging, and manages statutory overdue items to achieve corporate goals. Works closely with zone offices, brokers, insureds and audit department to resolve open items, discrepancies and collection issues. Communicates with agents, underwriting and policyholders regarding open items and collection issues. Documents collection activity in accordance with department procedures. Processes cash daily in the WINS Premium Accounting system, cash balancing and bank deposits. Processes check disbursements. Communicates often with department manager regarding aged items, collection and customer service issues.
* Research statutorily overdue items monthly and provide required information to department management for reporting on a quarterly basis. Identify items for adjustments.
* Review and analyze various monthly Premium Accounting reports to assist management in identifying trends and potential collection problems. Report status monthly on overdue items greater than $10,000, with recommendations for resolution.
* Reconcile unapplied cash, initiate cash disbursements and identify write-offs in accordance with department guidelines.
* Mail monthly statements to agents and insureds. The electronic filing of statements, cash receipts, cash disbursements, write-offs and account current statements in Laserfiche to ensure an accurate audit trail.
* Complete quarterly and annual asset impairment analysis.
* Reconcile and balance department cash to the bank and general ledger.
* Assist with projects and system testing as requested.
* Assist colleagues with processing of work during busy periods.


Education and Experience Required:* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) is required.
* 3 years commercial insurance experience is required.
* Premium Accounting or collection experience is preferred.

title: Territory Sales Manager
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a results-driven Territory Sales Manager (TSM) to join our team. The TSM will serve as a key representative for one of Azend Pharma’s clients, a specialty pharmacy, within the designated territory. In this role, you will be marketing your pharmacy’s services to healthcare providers. You will be responsible for executing innovative sales strategies aimed at driving pharmacy growth and maximizing client satisfaction.

You will be responsible for establishing the specialty pharmacy as the preferred pharmacy of choice by identifying opportunities to support prescribers and their patients through a consultative and relationship-based approach. TSM will act as a liaison between medical practices and the pharmacy.

**Important Note:** This is strictly an in-person role. Candidates must be physically present in the field and not working remotely or in a hybrid capacity.

**Responsibilities:**

· Develop a comprehensive understanding of the healthcare market, pharmacy operations, prescriber workflows, and specialty pharmacy services.

· Achieve sales growth through creating new and maintaining existing prescriber relationships.

· Pre-call planning to ensure an organized workflow and effective sales techniques.

· Document calls and notes in our CRM, and complete strategic planning reports.

**Qualifications:**

· One year of healthcare or related sales experience preferred.

· Strong communications and presentation skills with a competitive desire to succeed.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

· Applicant must have a valid US driver's license and car for travel and driving record in compliance with company standards.

· Candidate must live within 25 miles of territory.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
Skills Required:


* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
* Oracle EBS experience strongly preferred, AS400/BPCS experience a plus
* Experience with table-based query tools such as Microsoft Access, Hyperion Studio, Oracle Discoverer a plus
* Strong data entry ability and aptitude to learn to new tools and processes
* Superior level of accuracy, attention to detail
* Solutions and customer service oriented, positive attitude
* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple competing priorities

  

Company Overview:

  



Party City Holdco Inc. (PCHI) is a global leader in the celebrations industry. A vertically integrated designer, manufacturer, distributor, and retailer, PCHI offers consumer party goods in more than 100 countries around the world.

  



PCHI team members demonstrate a daily commitment to the company's Brand Purpose: to inspire joy by making it easy for customers to create unforgettable memories by connecting them to everything they need for life's many celebrations.

  



PCHI operates multiple business divisions, including the Retail Division and the Consumer Products Division. On the retail side, Party City (partycity.com) is a leading omnichannel retailer in the celebrations category, operating more than 800 company-owned and franchise stores throughout North America. Additional Halloween City (halloweencity.com) pop-up storefronts are also located throughout North America seasonally. Comprising the Consumer Products Group are design and manufacturing entities Amscan, an industry leader across multiple celebrations goods and costumes, and Anagram, a dominant player in balloons.

  



Job Overview:

  



The accounts payable specialist assists with the Company’s financial transactions related to supplier payments and other expenses. The specialist participates in processing PO and non-PO invoices, reconciling discrepancies, processing expense reports, preparing payments, maintaining accurate spend and tax records, communicates with suppliers, and assists the accounts payable and broader finance management as needed with audit support, month end close, and reporting.

  



Responsibilities and Duties:

  


* Daily review and reconciliation of purchase orders, receiving reports and vendor invoices
* Perform invoice audits for mathematical accuracy, coding, and appropriate approval
* Process expense reports and other non-PO invoices into the ERP
* Monitor and audit offshore team transactions across the accounts payable workstream – invoice posting, vendor master changes, expense reports, etc.
* Assist with weekly pay runs – handing/mailing checks, assist management with batch review
* Participate in month end close process, duties include but are not limited to preparing to close A/P subledger, review outstanding receiving reports, invoices not yet entered into the system and other evidence of unrecorded liability and partner with accounting to prepare an accrual for all outstanding accounts payable
* Assist management with continuous improvement – propose enhancements to internal controls and system or process efficiencies
* Provide ongoing education to team members in other departments relative to the accounts payable area and Company policy
* Address incoming inquiries from vendors concerning past dues, discrepancies and other questions and concerns
* Assist with annual preparation and filing of 1099s and coordinate with team members regarding year-end audit requirements
* Perform special accounting projects and prepare recurring or ad hoc reports for management


Skills Required:


* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
* Oracle EBS experience strongly preferred, AS400/BPCS experience a plus
* Experience with table-based query tools such as Microsoft Access, Hyperion Studio, Oracle Discoverer a plus
* Strong data entry ability and aptitude to learn to new tools and processes
* Superior level of accuracy, attention to detail
* Solutions and customer service oriented, positive attitude
* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple competing priorities
* Problem Solving:
* Ability to proactively identify potential roadblocks and recommend solutions
* Ability to partner with internal stakeholders and suppliers to resolve discrepancies and disputes


Interpersonal Skills:


* Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential
* Ability to communicate cross-culturally and partner with team members globally and locally

  



Qualifications:


* Minimum 3 years of relevant high-volume accounts payable experience required, retail industry experience preferred
* High school graduate or GED required, degree in Accounting or Business Administration a plus

title: Staff Associate II (Data Analyst)
description:
This opportunity to join the Department of Pediatrics at the Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons at the rank of Staff Associate II is an exciting one. Columbia University Irving Medical Center, one of the nation’s foremost academic health science centers. The Department of Pediatrics at Columbia University Irving Medical Center is the top in comparison with other pediatrics department in the NY region in NIH research funding.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

A full time Data Analyst for Molecular Medicine Learning Healthcare Program is needed to work under limited supervision of the Principal Investigators. Candidate will work with the research team to extract data elements from various sources, clean and develop data systems, perform statistical analyses including analysis using longitudinal data, propensity score and other comorbidity adjustment methods, latent variable analyses, advanced regression techniques including multilevel modeling and survival methods. The candidate will also interpret study results, prepare reports for publication, and train and supervise trainees in computer programming and quantitative skills. Examples of types of projects involve linking and analyzing clinical data from the Epic EHR to genetic, genomic, proteomic and/or metabolomic data from hospitalized children; developing predictive algorithms for in-hospital events; investigating pattens and quality of care for hospitalized children.

Ideal candidates will be detail-oriented and passionate about using data to solve problems in research, and able to think creatively and plan strategically. Innovative thinking and a willingness to learn and adopt new technologies will be crucial to success in this role. Come join Columbia University Department of Pediatrics, Division of Critical Care, Hospital and Palliative Medicine.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor’s degree in biomedical informatics, Epidemiology, Computer Science, Data Science, Biostatistics, or Statistics plus 2-3 years experience. Master’s or Doctoral degree in related field could substitute for experience.
* Strong understanding of data design, architecture, relational databases and data modeling.
* Clear demonstration of technical, analytical, organizational, problem solving and communication skills.
* Prior experience with Epic Clarity data models, or other clinical data systems.
* Python, R, SQL, SAS, SPSS, Stata or similar software for statistical analysis and data science.
* Excellent attention to detail, ability to troubleshoot independently, and a sense of mission and purpose.

Preferred Criteria:

* Proficient in SQL and database modeling.
* Prior experience in clinical, public health, health services research.
* Experience with healthcare data.
* Experience with data visualization – Power BI.
* Epic Module Certification (Cogito) obtained within six months of employment.

COMPENSATION

Hiring Salary Range: $75,000 - $90,000

Pay Transparency Disclosure

The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to departmental budgets, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, and training. The above hiring range represents the University’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.

If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to: apply.interfolio.com/155408

COMMITMENT OF DIVERSITY

Columbia University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and Educator. The University is dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse and pluralistic faculty and staff committed to teaching and working in a diverse environment, and strongly encourages applications from women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans.

Columbia University welcomes applications from individuals who may have had nontraditional career paths, or who may have taken time off for family reasons (e.g. children, caring for disabled or elderly family), or who have achieved excellence in careers outside of academia (e.g., in professional or industry service). The University is responsive to the needs of dual career couples and is committed to supporting the work-life balance of its faculty. We are interested in candidates who have a record of success advising and mentoring individuals from groups underrepresented in higher education and is particularly interested in candidates who have research interests in subjects that will contribute to the understanding of diversity and equal opportunity.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person
