title: Restoration General Manager
description:
**Join Our Team: Experienced Restoration General Manager Wanted!** 

Are you an experienced leader with a passion for making a difference? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments where every day presents new challenges and opportunities? If so, we want you to be the driving force behind our team as our new General Manager for our leading mitigation company!

**About Us:**

We specialize in tackling the aftermath of disasters head-on, from floods and fires to storms and everything in between. With precision, compassion, and a relentless drive to restore normalcy, we're committed to being the guiding light in times of darkness.

**Our Commitment To You:**

**Generous PTO:** Your well-being matters. Enjoy ample paid time off to recharge and pursue your passions beyond the chaos.

**Competitive Pay:** Your hard work deserves recognition. We offer a compensation package that reflects your skills, experience, and dedication.

**Unlimited Potential for Growth:** Ready to take your career to new heights? Join us and unlock endless opportunities for personal and professional development.

**Positive Work Environment:** Join a team where every voice is valued, and every idea is welcomed. We foster inclusivity and support your success every step of the way.

**Strong Leadership:** Our leadership team comprises industry experts and visionaries who are dedicated to guiding and empowering you to reach your full potential.

**No Day Will Be the Same:** If you thrive on variety and love tackling new challenges, you'll feel right at home with us. Expect the unexpected, and embrace the excitement of every day.

**We Hear You! Your Ideas Matter:** Your insights can shape the future of our companies. Join us, and let your creativity and innovation shine.

**What we are looking for in our next team member:**

We're seeking a seasoned General Manager who can lead our team to new heights of success. As the backbone of our operations, you'll be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our business, from strategic planning to day-to-day management. Your leadership will guide our team to deliver exceptional service, maintain high standards of quality, and drive growth in our competitive industry.

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop and implement strategic plans to achieve company goals and objectives

- Provide strong leadership to motivate and empower our team members

- Ensure efficient and effective operation of all business functions, including project management, finance, and customer service

- Foster a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement

- Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders

- Monitor industry trends and competitive landscape to identify opportunities for growth and improvement

- Uphold the highest standards of integrity, professionalism, and ethical conduct

**Requirements:**

- Proven experience as a General Manager or similar leadership role in the mitigation or related industry

- Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams

- Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills

- Strategic thinker with a track record of driving results and achieving targets

- Solid understanding of business principles, financial management, and operational best practices

- Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Extended hours
* On call
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities
* Performance bonus

Application Question(s):

* How do you handle highly stressful situations?
* What is your motivation for success?
* Describe who you are as a person
* Describe your morals and values

Experience:

* Management: 10 years (Required)
* Restoration: 10 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Norwalk, CT 06854 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Financial Analyst
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Finance/Accounting/Purchasing
  

**Department** CINJ-Finance
  

**Overview**
Through our science, our evidence-based actions, our openness, and our respect for those we serve, we will advance cancer-focused research worldwide and reduce the burden of cancer in our catchment area. By engaging with and empowering our exceptionally diverse populations, and addressing their questions and fears, we will engender hope for cancer patients and their families and play a critical role in strengthening the fabric of our communities by gaining and
protecting their trust and providing access to the outstanding oncology care each person deserves.  

Our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery focused on understanding cancer, innovating cancer treatment, and improving cancer prevention; to provide outstanding, novel, and compassionate patient care; to provide evidence-based and culturally informed education to physicians, nurses, researchers, staff, and the community; and to achieve cancer health equity in our state through outreach to and engagement of our extraordinarily diverse communities.  

Curiosity and Discovery, Integrity, Collaboration, Cultivating Diversity, Respect and Caring, Perseverance.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Financial Analyst within the Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey.  

  

The Financial Analyst supports day-to-day operations of the organization through transaction processing, budget monitoring, and financial planning. General responsibilities include expenditure review and approvals, revenue processing and other accounting functions, preparation of routine and ad hoc reports and analysis, budget development and monitoring, and the enforcement of financial rules, regulations and policies. The position assists stakeholders inside and outside of the department of finance with numerous financial matters, and ensures the efficient use of resources to advance the mission of the Rutgers Cancer Institute.  

  

Among the key duties for this position are the following:* Responsible for research, analysis and organization of budgets and expenditures for assigned operational areas with the Rutgers Cancer Institute.
* Ensures funding information for all personnel is accurate by monitoring reports and budgets, and processing funding changes in Rutgers systems as needed.
* Prepares P&L statements, productivity and budget status reports for Rutgers Cancer Institute units (e.g. clinical divisions, service departments, faculty level, etc.).
* Contributes to the creation of the annual budget and quarterly financial forecasts, including data entry and updates into the EPBCS system.
* Collaborates with internal teams to collect necessary data for the state appropriation budget application and quarterly submissions. Conduct thorough reviews and analyses of all information and documents to ensure compliance and accuracy for state reporting. Upload and submit all relevant materials via the NJ SAGE state portal.
* Prepares and submit journal entries within the Oracle system, ensuring the accurate update of revenue and expense schedules.
* Compiles and maintains A/R and A/P reconciliation schedules, ensuring the completeness of reconciliations for submission to Rutgers Central. Prepare monthly and quarterly AR invoices and follow up on outstanding payments.
* Monitors daily ACH communications from Rutgers Central. Prepare and submit check deposits, handle drop-offs at bank locations, and ensure the timely and accurate clearing of cash entries.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
This position requires a fully on-site work arrangement.
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 24S
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 67074.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 80433.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 95462.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** HPAE 5094
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field, plus three (3) years of related experience in related fiscal activities.
* Equivalent experience, education and/or training may be substituted for the degree requirements.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Experience in preparing full P&L statements required.
* Knowledge and experience with journal entries, financial statement preparation and general accounting concepts are also required.
* Demonstrated strong verbal and written communications, analytical abilities.
* Effective oral and written communication skills.
* Must be computer literate with proficiency and working knowledge of database and reporting tools such as Microsoft Word, Access, and PowerPoint.
* Advanced skill level in Excel required.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in healthcare industry (e.g physician practice or hospital) preferred.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* **PHYSICAL****DEMANDS****:** Standing, sitting, walking, talking and hearing. No special vision requirements. Lifting up to 25 lbs.
* **WORK****ENVIRONMENT****:** Office environment. Moderate noise.


  

**Special Conditions**
  

Posting Details
**Posting Number** 24ST2265
  

**Posting Open Date**
  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**
  

**Regional Campus** Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS)
  

**Home Location Campus** Downtown New Brunswick
  

**City** New Brunswick
  

**State** NJ
  

**Location Details**
  

Pre-employment Screenings
All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Student Assistant (Research)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Student Assistant (Research)
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** SHP-Rehab & Movement
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Health Professions (SHP) is seeking a Student Assistant for the Department of Rehabilitation & Movement Science.  

  

The Student Assistant will assist with chart/record reviews, data processing and analysis, and transcriptions and content analysis of focus group interviews, research-related and clerical tasks as needed.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Completes the appropriate training to serve as a student assistant (CITI training, project-specific training with the PI).
* Assists with a retrospective chart review project by extracting data from electronic charts and processing data.
* Serves as a co-facilitator/note taker in focus group meetings on site in the Stanley Bergen Building or via zoom.
* Assists with transcription checking and content analysis as directed by the PI.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 or the applicable provisions of relevant collective negotiations agreements, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or discontinuation, and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System.
  

**FLSA** Nonexempt
  

**Grade** 99H
  

**Position Salary** $17 per hour
  

**Annual Minimum Salary**
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary**
  

**Annual Maximum Salary**

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Description:
**Job Title: Executive Assistant**

**Company:** Live Urgent Care LLC

**About Us:** Live Urgent Care is a leading provider of urgent and occupational health services, dedicated to delivering high-quality care to our patients. As we continue to grow, we are looking for an organized and proactive Executive Assistant to support our C-suite executives.

**Position Overview:** The Executive Assistant will play a crucial role in enhancing the efficiency of our C-suite by managing schedules, coordinating meetings, and handling various administrative tasks. This position requires a high level of professionalism, discretion, and a strong ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Manage the calendars of C-suite executives, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
* Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, and presentations.
* Assist in the coordination of special projects and initiatives.
* Act as a liaison between executives and internal/external stakeholders.
* Organize and maintain filing systems and documents.
* Handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism.
* Perform general administrative duties as needed.

**Schedule:**

* Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM.
* Hybrid position: 4 days onsite and 1 day remote.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
* 401(k) with company match.
* Generous paid time off and holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development.


Join us at Live Urgent Care LLC and be part of a dedicated team committed to providing exceptional healthcare services!


Requirements:
**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or a related field preferred.
* 3+ years of experience as an executive assistant or in a similar role.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with diverse groups.

title: Assistant Director of Nursing (ADON)/Infection Preventionist
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are seeking an experienced Infection Preventionist to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in preventing and controlling infections within our healthcare facility.

\\*Responsibilities\\*

- Oversee and manage all aspects of nursing operations within the organization  
- Provide leadership and guidance to nursing staff, ensuring high-quality patient care  
- Develop and implement policies and procedures to maintain compliance with regulatory standards  
- Collaborate with other departments to coordinate patient care and ensure smooth operations  
- Monitor and evaluate nursing staff performance, providing feedback and coaching as needed  
- Manage staffing levels and schedules to ensure adequate coverage and efficient workflow  
- Participate in the hiring, training, and development of nursing staff  
- Maintain accurate documentation and records related to patient care and nursing operations  
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in nursing administration

- Develop, implement, and evaluate infection prevention and control policies and procedures

- Conduct regular surveillance to identify infection risks and trends

- Provide education and training to staff on infection prevention protocols

- Collaborate with healthcare teams to ensure compliance with infection control standards

- Investigate outbreaks of infections and implement appropriate control measures

- Stay current on infection prevention guidelines and best practices

```Experience```  
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in a leadership role in a healthcare setting  
- Strong knowledge of shift management and nursing administration principles  
- Familiarity with Medicare regulations and compliance requirements  
- Understanding of HIPAA regulations and patient privacy guidelines  
- Solid understanding of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology  
- Experience working in a nursing home, home care, or assisted living facility is preferred

\\*Requirements\\*

- Strong knowledge of managing infection prevention systems in an acute care setting

- Background in nursing administration with a focus on infection control

- Familiarity with Medicare regulations related to infection prevention

- Understanding of physiology and microbiology as it pertains to infections

- Demonstrated leadership skills in guiding staff on infection control practices

- Knowledge of resident rights in nursing homes and hospice care settings

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $105,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Geriatrics

Schedule:

* 5x8
* 8 hour shift

* Infection Control Certification (Required)
* RN (Required)

* Allenwood, NJ 08720 (Required)

title: Office Supervisor - Riverdale
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


The Office Supervisor is responsible for assisting in managing, overseeing, and ensuring the successful administrative, financial, and operational aspects of an urgent care location. A supervisor is accountable for:

* Managing team members in partnership with Practice Manager
* Supporting a patient-centric urgent care experience from welcome to departure of the facility and ensuring an inviting and hospitable environment
* Supporting overall functions of the site, team, and providers with day-to-day operations.

**Essential Functions/Responsibilities:**

**Site Management**

* Managing the performance of the site; understanding at all times of how many patients have visited the site, whether there are any delays in the registration process, and what follow-up needs to be conducted after a patient is discharged.
* Assisting the Practice Manager preparing the schedule for non-providers
* Ordering all medical supplies, medications, vaccinations, and office supplies for the site
* Opening and closing the site as required
* Assisting the Practice Manger in administrative and operational responsibilities

**People Management**

* Building strong positive communication with providers and working as a team to enhance the success of the practice.
* Ensuring staff always maintains professionalism, coaching, managing, and developing the staff.
* Managing the team from interviewing, performance, promotion, discipline, etc.
* Collaborating with the HR team to formalize a development plan for staff as well as managing employee relations issues such as formal write-ups and suggestions for improvement.

**Business and Patient Management**

* Maintaining patient confidentiality in accordance with policy and procedure as well as HIPAA requirements.
* Interacting with patients (and families) at discharge in a courteous and respectful manner, resolving disputes, and reviewing patient satisfaction cards.

**Qualifications**

* High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s degree in management, business or other applicable degree preferred (will consider relevant management experience in lieu of degree).
* Minimum 1 year of supervising or managing experience a must OR a degree in management.
* Ability to successfully multitask.
* Good computer skills (knowledge of a PC, Microsoft Office programs)
* Exceptional communication skills
* Comfortable with delivering constructive feedback and counseling management.
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on-site location.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required at time of hire.

**Additional Information:**


This job will require long shifts, weekends, closing, opening shifts (will depend on schedule necessary at facility) and must work on-site.

**Physical requirements:**


The job may require from time to time lifting heavy objects on a regular basis, doing repetitive tasks with few breaks, and requiring light cleaning. Heavy computer use required.

**Direct reports:**


The Supervisor will be responsible for directly managing the site employees.

**Pay:** **Starting at 24/hr**

The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.


#INDMgmt

**About Our Commitment**
========================

**Total Rewards at VillageMD**
------------------------------


Our team members are essential to our mission to reshape healthcare through the power of connection. VillageMD highly values the critical role that health and wellness play in the lives of our team members and their families. Participation in VillageMD’s benefit platform includes Medical, Dental, Life, Disability, Vision, FSA coverages and a 401k savings plan.

------------------------------

Our Company cares about the safety of our employees and applicants. Our Company does not use chat rooms for job searches or communications. Our Company will never request personal information via informal chat platforms or unsecure email. Our Company will never ask for money or an exchange of money, banking or other personal information prior to the in-person interview. Be aware of potential scams while job seeking. title: Weekend Nanny needed in Greenwich, CT
description:
Start: September 2024

Age(s) of Child(ren): 3 month old

Schedule: 40 hours per month

Compensation: $35-$40/hourly

Description:

**weekend Nanny needed in Greenwich**

A loving family of 3 is looking for a Weekend nanny for their 3 month old! The Schedule is flexible with about 10 hours per weekend. The family can guarantee 40 hours per month. This is a great position for a nanny who has a position during the week and is looking for extra hours. The position is located in Old Greenwich and begins as soon as the family finds a great fit.

**Ideal Nanny**

The ideal nanny candidate would embody a blend of professionalism, warmth, and reliability. They would have a sincere passion for childcare, consistently demonstrating patience, creativity, and enthusiasm in their interactions with children. With a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, they would be well-versed in developmental milestones, capable of planning and facilitating activities that promote learning and growth.

Possessing a valid First Aid/CPR certification, the candidate would prioritize safety and be prepared to handle emergencies efficiently. Their references would reflect a history of dependable, compassionate care, and their background check would be clear of any discrepancies. They would be a non-smoker with reliable transportation and a clean driving record, indicative of their dependability. Flexibility is crucial, and the ideal candidate would adapt seamlessly to our changing schedules, showing availability for occasional weekends and a long-term commitment to our family.

**Position Requirements**

* Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional childcare experience.
* Certification: Valid First Aid/CPR certification for infants and children.
* References: Excellent references from previous employers.
* Background Check: Clear background check.
* Communication: Strong communication skills in English.
* Driver’s License: Valid driver's license and clean driving record (for driving positions).
* Age Group Experience: Experience with newborns.
* Activity Planning: Ability to plan and engage in developmentally appropriate activities.
* Housekeeping: Willingness to perform light housekeeping related to the children.
* Non-Smoker: Must be a non-smoker.
* Transportation: Reliable transportation.
* Flexibility: Flexibility with hours and availability for occasional weekends.
* Commitment: Ability to commit long term.

* Weekends only

title: Staff Associate I
description:
**Job Overview**  
Incite at Columbia University invites applications for a Staff Associate I position to assist the Incite Director and other professional officers of research in the conduct of research projects at Incite. The position will begin November 1, 2024 and is initially for one year with the possibility of renewal contingent on satisfactory performance and the availability of funding.

**Responsibilities**

The Staff Associate will carry out assigned duties in the capture and analysis of data, and will manage workflow and support those projects at Incite that employ statistical analysis of large-scale, individual-level data that currently include:

Movements Against Mass Incarceration Lab, a Mellon Foundation-funded project that has partnered with five non-profits to captures stories of justice impacted people throughout the United States; and the George Soros Oral History Project, which assess through narrative the degree that Mr. Soros and Open Society Foundation influenced democracy worldwide based on decades of work; and the Leveraging Urban AI as a Communal Tool for Connection and Exchange in Harlem Project supported by the National Science Foundation on the structures and dynamics of AI on a community level; and the Labor Lab’s investigation of autoworker supply chain and labor standards at Alabama Hyundai contracted by Jobs to Move America.

**Specific Duties will Include:**

Supporting the data collection, processing, cleaning, statistical analysis, and reporting on various large-scale data INCITE projects. – 35%

Managing workflow by attending and organizing research team meetings, assisting in setting research agenda, assisting in identifying key research tasks to be performed by team members, communicating and assigning tasks as needed, and ensuring project research deliverables meet their timelines. — 30%

Crafting literature reviews and supporting the development of other research projects atINCITE on an as-needed basis. – 20%

Providing other research support as appropriate to meet project deliverables, including supporting a collective of researchers seeking to build a data core on various projects. – 15%  
**Qualifications**  
BA Degree

**Application Instructions**

All applications must be submitted through Columbia's online Academic Search and

Recruiting portal (ASR) and must include the following materials: CV and cover letter.

http://apply.interfolio.com/155128

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**

Columbia University is an Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

**Pay Transparency Disclosure :** The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to departmental budgets, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, and training. The above hiring range represents the University’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* Bachelor's (Required)

* New York, NY 10115: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Director, Contracting Solutions
description:
Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (JJHCS) is recruiting for a Director, Contracting Solutions in the sub-area of Application Support located in Raritan, NJ!



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



The Director, Contracting Solutions will be responsible for leading a group of specialized contracting professionals focused on the strategic lifecycle management of several tools/systems as well as collaborating with the respective technology teams.



Are you passionate about embracing technology to solve business challenges while shaping the long-term design of vendor roadmaps? We are sure this role will help you to deepen your understanding of the broad J&J enterprise and gain experience in bringing tangible improvements to the organization. If you are a problem solver and enjoy engaging with a diverse set of partners, we know this role is for you!



Key Responsibilities:


* Own the management of specialized software vendors in a full lifecycle management approach
* Collaborate with technology partners in incident management and defect management including escalation, metrics, and resource allocation
* Partner with stakeholders including, but not limited to, internal business partners, upstream/downstream technology resources, finance, and external industry associates
* Drive strong change management for in-scope system and tools
* Collaborate with peers (e.g., Regional & Global Process Owners) to stay current with process trends and leading practices occurring in the marketplace to inform strategic direction
* Lead multiple sub-teams focused on different sectors, countries, or areas of focus
* Collaborate with other enterprise projects that may influence or affect contracting solutions, processes, and systems (e.g., TranSCend, SigniFi, Cash Flow Generation Office)
* Lead market scans and evaluation of industry best-practices for Contracting and Revenue management systems
* Participate in events and engagement to shape future roadmap solutions for the industry
* Create resource goals & objectives and hold individuals accountable for execution
* As needed, make personnel decisions regarding hiring, performance, and termination
* Manage team/personnel budget as well as other financial tracking/reporting (e.g., Capital Acquisition Requests)
* Build and maintain relationships at all levels throughout the organization
* Lead effectively through times of crisis and ambiguity

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Education:


* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent


Experience and Skills:



Required:


* Minimum of ten years total business or related experience
* Project Management experience
* Understanding of J&J System Design Lifecycle (SDLC) Management
* Proficiency in English


Preferred:


* Prior experience with Revenue Management Systems (e.g., Model N, etc.) and ERP systems (e.g., SAP, JDE, etc.)
* Change management experience and/or certification
* Experience in working across multiple J&J sectors
* Experience in working across multiple countries/regions
* Six Sigma/Lean Belt or other process engineering certification
* Project Management Professional or equivalent certification
* Masters' degree or equivalent
* Familiarity with US Federal Government Contracting


Other:


* This position is anticipated to have up to 10% travel
* The anticipated base pay range for this position is $142,000 to $244,950.


The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
* Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.



For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

title: Permanent Part Time Substitute Teacher
company: St Luke PPreschool & Early CHildhood Center
description:
St. Luke Preschool and Early Childhood Center in Dix Hills, NY is seeking a Part-Time Substitute Assistant Teacher for our Preschool for the 2024-2025 school year. We are looking for someone who would be interested in a permanent, part-time position starting asap. Schedule would be Tuesday and Thursdays from 9:00am-1:30pm with additional subbing hours available.

The Teacher Assistant is responsible for knowing and following the OCFS regulations. A person in this position is to support the preschool Lead Teacher.

**Primary Duties and Responsibilities**

1. Must be a person of faith and reflect and support Christian beliefs in daily lessons and interactions with the children, families and staff.

2. Assist the teacher in planning and implementing activities with children.

3. Plan activities for children such as storytelling or art projects.

4. Instruct and supervise them in social and developmental activities.

5. Generally provide one-on-one attention when needed.

6. Help organize the classroom.

7. Help plan intellectual activities for children, per Lead Teacher’s request.

8. Good communication skills and patience.

9. Assist Lead Teacher in reviewing the progress of each child and planning activities that are supportive.

10. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with children, parents, staff, program specialists and Director.

11. Work with Lead Teacher to facilitate activities for all children both indoors and outdoors.

12. The Teacher Assistant is supervised in the classroom by the Lead Teacher and by the Center Director.

13. Assists the Lead Teacher in entering accurate attendance records.

14. Attends all staff meetings.

15. Performs any other task deemed necessary by the Lead Teacher and/or Center Director.

16. Assumes the Lead Teacher’s full role in the absence of the Lead Teacher and supervises the substitute who will act as the Teacher Assistant during that period.

17. Works cooperatively with the Lead Teacher and the classroom family to encourage the active participation of all families in the program.

18. It is understood that the Teacher Assistant will work the hours assigned by the Center Director.

19. Help maintain the cleanliness and care of the classroom.

20. Complete 15 hours of training needed each year in early childhood education within the 10 areas required by New York State.

**How to apply**

This part-time position is available immediately. Interested applicants should submit a cover letter, resume, and references to: St Luke Preschool Director- Director@stlukedixhills.org

title: Sales Specialist Millwork
description:
**Competitive Pay, Great Benefits and Monthly Bonus Potential of up to $1200!**

Pay Range for CA, CO, NJ, NY, WA: $18.00 - $21.60 per hour

Compensation Disclaimer: Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.

**What You Will Do**

All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products our customers need. As a Sales Specialist this means:

* Being friendly and professional, eager to understand the customer’s specific needs in order to pair the best products and service offerings in support of their project.
* Ensuring displayed merchandise reflects our high standards of showroom readiness, operates as intended during demonstrations, and is up to date, accurately mirroring the manufacturers current product offering.
* Engaging in safe work practices including the proper operation of store equipment.

The Sales Specialist serves as an expert, explaining the specifications and features of a product or service to existing or potential customers, with the goal of closing a sale. This associate provides exceptional consultative services to customers and confirms their needs are met before leaving the store. The Sales Specialist is also responsible for executing orders and projects in their area of focus.*Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores.*

**What We're Looking For**

* Hourly Full Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
* Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
* Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
* Minimally must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance; may lift over 25 pounds with or without assistance.

**What You Need To Succeed**  
*Minimum Qualifications*

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* 1 year of external experience in customer facing sales OR 6 months Lowe's retail experience.

*Preferred Qualifications*

* 1 year of experience entering and submitting customer sales orders, including Special Order Sales.
* 2 years of experience identifying and selling products based upon customer needs or plans.
* 2 years of experience in providing customer service including identifying and resolving customer complaints, greeting customers, answering phones, building relationships with customers, and thanking customers for their business.
* 2 years of experience following up on outstanding or incomplete customer orders, sales, or installs.
* 1 year of experience promoting product related services and plans such as installation, delivery, credit financing, or extended protection plans.
* 2 years of experience in a sales environment with required sales goals or metrics.
* 1 year of employment with Lowe's as a Sales Specialist.

If the state or local municipality requires a salesperson license for this position, you must either be licensed or pass the requisite licensing exam within sixty (60) days of starting employment in this position.

By submitting your details via this Indeed job posting, you authorize Lowe's to contact you and request additional personal information, as needed, related to the application process. Please note – to be considered for this role; you must complete a full application at jobs.lowes.com.

For job application questions or assistance, please call 1-844-HR Lowes (1-844-475-6937).

title: Parts Driver
description:
***Job description:***

***Volkswagen of Nanuet*** is currently searching for a Wholesale Parts Driver to start driving for our dealership in ***Nanuet, NY***. We are looking for an energetic and team-oriented individual to join our staff. Are you looking to grow your career with an expanding organization? Are you interested in professional career development? We primarily promote from within, so if you are interested in joining a team who prioritizes your long-term goals, this could be a natural fit for you!

***Summary:***

Delivers and picks up parts and equipment for the dealership.

***\\*\\*A CLEAN DRIVERS LICENSE IS REQUIRED\\*\\**** 

***Responsibilities:*** 

* Picks up and delivers parts and equipment to customers, satellite stores, wholesale accounts, and vendors.
* Checks with the parts manager, wholesale representative, inventory control administrator, parts counter people or shipping and receiving clerk before leaving to coordinate any last-minute pick-ups or deliveries.
* Checks with the body shop each day to determine immediate parts needs.
* Delivers parts to body shop when needed and distributes to appropriate body technicians.
* Verifies that invoice matches purchase order for each pick-up.
* Checks payments received with the invoices for each delivery.
* Keeps an accurate log of daily deliveries and pick-ups. Requests recipient's signature on each delivery entry.
* Unloads truck each night. Turns in all paperwork and undelivered parts.
* Handles basic maintenance of the truck including filling tank with gas, checking oil, keeping it clean and making sure required inspections are performed.
* Advises parts manager if delivery trucks need major repairs and maintenance.
* Helps maintain the professional appearance of the parts department.
* Assists service department as needed with attendant responsibilities of managing the drop-off and pick-up of customers' cars.
* Helps with stocking and posting orders when they arrive to expedite delivery to shop technicians and wholesale accounts.
* Maintains professional appearance.
* Other tasks as assigned.

title: Social Media Content Creator (E-commerce)
description:
**Position:** Social Media Video Editor and Content Creator**Location:** Brooklyn, NY (In-Office)**Company:** Mockins

**About Us:**At Mockins, we’re a rapidly growing E-Commerce company based in Brooklyn, NY. We pride ourselves on creativity and innovation, delivering engaging content that captivates and resonates with our audience. If you’re passionate about storytelling and ready to join a vibrant, forward-thinking team, we’d love to hear from you!

**Role Overview:**We’re looking for a talented Social Media Video Editor and Content Creator to amplify our social media presence. This role is ideal for someone who excels in creating compelling and trend-setting content across multiple platforms. You will produce high-quality photo, video, and graphic content, leveraging platforms such as TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, Facebook, and Pinterest to engage our audience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Create and Implement Content:** Develop and execute creative social media content strategies for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.
* **Maintain Brand Consistency:** Ensure all content reflects our brand’s tone and voice for a consistent and authentic presence.
* **Utilize Design Tools:** Use Canva, Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere, After Effects, Photoshop), and Capcut to craft visually engaging content.
* **Trend Monitoring:** Stay updated on industry trends to continually enhance our content strategies.
* **Project Management:** Handle multiple projects simultaneously, meeting tight deadlines while maintaining high-quality standards.
* **Collaboration and Independence:** Work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* **Experience:** 2-3 years of experience in social media content production with a proven track record of creating viral content.
* **Portfolio:** A strong portfolio showcasing relevant work (please provide a link or references).
* **Product Marketing:** Experience with content creation specifically for physical products.
* **AI Tools:** Familiarity with AI tools for content creation, including voice-over and image/video generation.
* **Project Estimation:** Ability to accurately estimate resources and time required for production tasks.
* **Research and Content Creation:** Excellent research skills and the capability to produce both informative and engaging content.
* **Organizational Skills:** Strong organizational and communication skills, with adaptability to shifting priorities.
* **Feedback and Collaboration:** Openness to feedback and a commitment to fostering a positive, collaborative work environment.
* **Desirable Skills:** Photography and light retouching skills are highly desirable; experience with 3D modeling is a plus.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Innovative Team:** Be part of a creative, dynamic team in a rapidly growing company.
* **Growth Opportunities:** Access opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* **Supportive Environment:** Work in a collaborative and supportive environment at our Brooklyn office.

**Schedule:**

Monday - Thursday: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM - 1:00/2:00 PM

**How to Apply:** 

Ready to elevate your social media content creation career? If you meet the qualifications and are excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why you’re a great fit for our team.

**Apply Now!**

title: Asst. Director, Trade Management & Analytics
description:
Description:

Lactalis American Group is currently seeking candidates to join our team in **New York.**


Lactalis, the world leader in dairy, is a family-owned business with more than 85,000 pragmatic and ambitious professionals worldwide, committed to nurturing the future by providing healthy and delicious dairy products that bring people together every day. We produce award-winning dairy products that bring people together every day. We offer an enviable range of dairy brands including **Galbani®, Président®, Kraft® Natural Cheese, Cracker Barrel®, Black Diamond®, Parmalat®, Siggi’s®, and Stonyfield Organic®** in addition to several brands imported from our affiliates in Europe.


At Lactalis, our core values of **AMBITION**, **ENGAGEMENT**, and **SIMPLICITY** are at the heart of everything we do. We are dedicated to building a safe, diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace and we know that our candidates come from many different backgrounds, cultures, and experiences. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job posting, we still encourage you to apply and share with us your **STORY**, your **PASSION**, and your **EXPERTISE**! You may be just the perfect candidate for this or other roles within our company.

 **From your PASSION to ours**


The Assistant Director, Trade Management & Analytics has three primary roles.


Trade fund/financial/data analytics: Will develop processes and tools to analyze and guide the assigned business trade funds so that they are used most efficiently to achieve the assigned business/LAG objectives, and adhere to all corporate and regulatory guidelines. Analyzethe assigned business financials to optimize the top and bottom-line results. Responsible for accurate trade spending forecasts/reporting.


Assigned business systems and deduction management: Will ensure/challenge that assigned business has updated trade and price management systems. Responsible for Prism price list and deduction management.


Assigned business forecast accuracy: Working closely with assigned business VP/field sales and financial planning and analysis, support our challenge to provide accuracy in volume and trade forecasting.

**From your EXPERTISE to ours**

*Key responsibilities for this position include:*

* Work with assigned business VP to develop overall trade fund GTMS aligned with company objectives, and effectively manage and analysis strategy implementation.
* Responsible for tracking progress of initiatives and identifying areas for improvement.
* Develop and nurture a strong relationship with all field sales managers and key brokers, specifically in the trade support functions.
* Demonstrate through active engagement with field sales how to apply processes to improve team focus and execution.
* Leverage existing trade tools to ensure accurate and effective reporting of dollars spent and accruals needed.
* Evaluate key sales tools for opportunities to integrate/leverage key processes in a more efficient manner:
* Trade management development;
* Trade and financial reporting tools;
* Opportunity tracking.
* Lead project management for any new system implementations related to the trade marketing team.
* Analyze performance metrics data and leverage it to effectively coach and develop the sales support team.
* Lead the trade marketing team to execute effective management of trade processes and systems.
* Manage the Prism price list and deductions.
* Demonstrate commitment to a safe working environment that promotes the health and well-being of all employees and that will further contribute to the Company’s overall performance and success.
* Travel and/or extended or off work hours may be required.
* This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions, it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.
* To fulfill these responsibilities, tools such as a computer, phone, and/or allowance(s) may be provided.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these Essential Duties and Responsibilities.


Requirements: **From your STORY to ours**

*Qualified applicants will contribute the following:*

**Education**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required;
* MBA degree is preferred; or equivalent experience to include a minimum of ten (10) years job related experience.

**Experience**

* 10+ years management experience required.
* 10+ years related experience required.
* Experience in food industry preferred.

**Specialized Knowledge**

* CPG industry knowledge or sales.

**Skills / Abilities**

* Communication, organization and computer skills.
* Strong ability to use Excel.


Lactalis is an equal employment opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against applicants with regard to any legally-recognized basis including, but not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, and physical or mental disabilities.

title: Physical Education and Health Teacher
description:
**Physical Education Teacher (Elementary)Summary:** Under the general supervision of the School Director, to develop students' physical skills and abilities, strength, agility, poise, coordination, and teamwork; to develop students' understanding of the importance of exercise to physical and mental well-being; and to motivate students to work towards, physical fitness, hygiene, and good health.

**Compensation:** Base Salary-Certified-$71,500, (Adv. Degrees $3,000 for masters, $5,000 for doctorate). $200/ year for applicable experience.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university is required. (Masters perferred)
* Valid New York Instructional Certificate and Subject Area Endorsement or eligibility
* Motor Vehicle Operator’s License or ability to provide own transportation.
* Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing, using proper grammar and vocabulary
* Demonstrate working knowledge of the use of various technological software and equipment for tasks such as, but not limited to, word processing, data management, information retrieval, visual presentations, and telecommunications.
* Understand the requirement to maintain confidentiality concerning charter school-related matters.
* Knowledge of child growth and development, individual differences in ability, personality and interests and learning/motivational techniques.
* Knowledge of applicable federal and state laws regarding education and students.
* Knowledge of current teaching methods and educational pedagogy, as well as differentiated instruction based upon student learning styles.
* Knowledge of physiology, health and nutrition, biology and biological functions, anatomy, hygiene, exercise, and best ways to promote physical and mental well-being.
* Knowledge of grade specific school curriculum and concepts, including all subject matters taught.
* Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth.
* Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work; parents, students, faculty etc.
* Knowledge of Smartboard functions and tools.
* Prior to employment, the following must be addressed:
* Required to complete a criminal history background check to prove that the individual has not been convicted of a crime or a disorderly person’s offense.
* Provide evidence that health is adequate to fulfill the job functions and responsibilities with reasonable accommodation.
* Provide evidence Tdap (Tetanus-diphtheria-acellular pertussis) Rubella, Measles, Mumps, Tuberculosis/PPD Test and Varicella

Meet such alternatives to the above qualifications as the school director finds appropriate and acceptable.

**Requirements/Environmental Conditions:**

The physical demands and work environment factors described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Requires prolonged sitting or standing
* Occasionally requires physical exertion to manually move, lift, carry, pull, or push objects or materials.
* Requires the ability to work in noisy and crowded environments.
* Occasionally requires stooping, bending, or reaching.
* Requires some traveling.
* Occasionally requires work outdoors dealing with school activities.

**Essential Performance Responsibilities** (The following description is illustrative of tasks and responsibilities. It is not meant to be all inclusive of every task or responsibility.)

The Physical Education Teacher will:

* Develops and administers Physical Education classes consistent with school district goals and objectives.
* Teaches knowledge of, and develops skills and abilities in, physical fitness, rhythm and dance, coordination and agility, exercise, and sports,
* Develops students' concepts in leadership, teamwork, responsibility and social skills; providing a safe and optimal learning environment; and appropriate feedback to regarding student progress, expectations, and goals.
* Conducts ongoing assessment of student growth and progress in physical educational activities, and modifies instructional methods to fit individual student's needs, including students with special needs.
* Continues to acquire professional knowledge and learn of current developments in the educational field by attending seminars, workshops or professional meetings, or by conducting research.
* Organizes and maintains a system for accurate and complete record-keeping, grading, and reporting for all student activities, achievement and attendance as required by district procedures and applicable laws.
* Assists in coordinating extra-curricular activities, including student performances, assembles, and athletic events.
* Encourages parental involvement in students' education and ensures effective communication with students and parents.
* Ensures that student conduct conforms to the school's standards and school district policies, and establishes and maintains standards of student behavior needed to achieve a functional learning atmosphere in the classroom.
* Coordinates with other professional staff members, especially within physical education and grade level, and participates in faculty meetings and committees.
* Selects and requisitions appropriate instructional aids and other supplies and equipment and maintains inventory records.
* Inspects equipment and field areas used to ensure they are in good and safe working order.

Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Principal and other central office administrators as designated by the Superintendent.

**Note:** The above description is illustrative of tasks and responsibilities. It is not meant to be all inclusive of every task or responsibility.

**Experience:** Successful prior teaching experience for the appropriate grade level preferred.

**Equipment**: Uses standard office equipment such as personal computers, printer, copy and fax machines, and telephone.

**Travel Requirements:** Travels to school district buildings and professional meetings as required.

**Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards**

Works in standard office and school building environments.

**Note:** Also see the Summary of Physical, Sensory and Environmental Requirements Needed to Perform Essential Functions for this position.

**Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards**

Works in standard office and school building environments.

title: Reauthorization Specialist - Infusion
description:
Description:

Promptcare is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Reauthorization Specialist to join our team. The Reauthorization Specialist will be responsible for obtaining and maintaining insurance authorizations for infusion therapy services. The ideal candidate will have experience in healthcare insurance and be able to work in a fast-paced environment. If you are a self-starter with a passion for healthcare and a desire to make a difference in patients' lives, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. To learn more about our company, visit us at PromptCare In-home Respiratory and Infusion

Location: New Providence, NJ

* Excellent oral and written communication skills are required to communicate with colleagues, management, patients, and physician offices

title: Head of Cybersecurity Transformation
description:
Company Description


MarketAxess is on a journey to digitally transform one of the world’s largest financial markets, enabling the shift from analog, phone-based trading to a fully electronic marketplace. Why does this matter? Because our platform makes trading fixed-income more accessible, ultimately improving transparency, efficiency, and competition in the marketplace. Changing the way an established industry transacts is no easy feat. There will be twists and turns, because no one’s ever done this before. But now, more than 2,000 clients around the world rely on our solutions, and that number is only expected to grow in the years ahead. We know where we’re going. How we get there is up to us. Join us and help Take Us There.

**The Role**



We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Head of Cybersecurity Transformation to assist the CISO in driving the strategic change initiatives required to evolve and enhance the organization’s cybersecurity capabilities. Reporting to the Chief Information Security Officer, this role is responsible for leading large-scale cybersecurity transformation projects across the enterprise, including the design, implementation, and management of cutting-edge security frameworks, processes, and technologies. The role requires a strategic leader who can partner across the security departments, business units, influence senior executives, and lead cross-functional teams in delivering next-generation security capabilities.


**How You'll Help Take Us There**


* Assist the CISO with the development and execution of the organization’s cybersecurity transformation strategy, ensuring alignment with broader business and IT goals.
* Assist the information security organization with the adoption of a forward-looking cybersecurity vision, incorporating emerging technologies, automation, and AI-driven security operations.
* Champion digital transformation initiatives, integrating security into enterprise-wide modernization efforts such as cloud migration, digital platforms, and DevOps practices.
* Ability to represent the CISO and other technology executives to clients, regulators, and partners.
* Support in improving the operational efficiency of the entire information security department by sharing and implementing best practices and standards.
* Help Lead large-scale, cross-functional cybersecurity programs across the various information security functions
* Promote innovation within the cybersecurity organization, encouraging the exploration and deployment of emerging security technologies to counter advanced threats.
* Ensure coordination and alignment across departments, including IT, product development, operations, and business functions, to drive the success of transformation initiatives.
* Serve as a key liaison between the cybersecurity function and senior leadership, communicating the progress and impact of transformation efforts.
* Help to influence and partner with C-level executives, business unit leaders, and external stakeholders to drive adoption and support for cybersecurity initiatives.
* Represent the CISO in internal and external forums, promoting the organization’s efforts to modernize security.
* Help the organizational shift towards a cybersecurity-conscious culture, ensuring security awareness and best practices are integrated into daily operations across all departments.


**What We’re Looking for**


* Proven work experience in a cybersecurity leadership role like a Deputy-CISO, Business CISO, Field CISO, BISO, or a COS or COO in the Information Security department.
* 10+ years of experience in cybersecurity, with a strong focus on leading large-scale security transformation initiatives.
* 7+ years of leadership experience in cybersecurity, including building and managing high-performing teams.
* Proven track record of managing complex, multi-year cybersecurity programs, ideally within a large enterprise or highly regulated environment.
* Strong understanding of security architecture, risk management, and compliance in a modern IT environment, including cloud, DevOps, and digital transformation.
* Expertise in implementing security frameworks, technologies, and methodologies, including zero trust, security automation, and threat intelligence.
* Strong leadership and project management skills, with experience leading cross-functional teams and managing budgets.
* Experience in engaging with senior executives, boards, and external stakeholders on cybersecurity strategies and transformations.


**Preferred Skills:**  

* Ability to execute in complex and dynamic environments.
* Hands-on experience with modern security technologies and platforms, including cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP), security orchestration and automation (SOAR), and advanced endpoint protection.
* Visionary thinker with the ability to articulate a long-term transformation roadmap while driving immediate, actionable improvements.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate technical details into business value for executive leadership and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to navigate complex and evolving security challenges.
* Highly collaborative with the ability to influence and drive organizational change.

**What You Can Expect from Us**


* Hybrid Environment: Our employees enjoy a mix of working in the office and from home
* Free Food: We provide free lunch for employees when they are working in the office. Plus, our offices are stocked with snacks
* Paid Time Off: Competitive PTO package including vacation and personal days, sick leave and charity days
* Generous Parental Leave: Up to 20 weeks fully paid leave
* 401(k): Dollar-for-dollar employer match up to $17,500
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Employees can purchase MarketAxess common stock at a discount
* Wellness Stipend: We provide employees with up to $1K annually towards gym memberships, home office equipment and more
* Onsite Healthcare: We offer convenient access to world-class care through Mount Sinai at our Hudson Yards location
* Tuition Assistance and Professional Development: Benefit from live and on-demand learning, role-specific training, employee-led Lunch and Learns and guest speakers
* Core benefits: Highly competitive medical, dental, and vision programs


For job positions in NYC, NY, and other locations where required, the estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is $200,000 USD to $275,000 USD. Actual salary may vary depending on job-related factors, which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. You may also be eligible for annual cash incentives, equity, and other benefit programs.

title: Customer Service Agent (Part-Time)
description:
Description:
**Job Scope:**

**Omni-Serv** is seeking Customer Service Agents with excellent Customer Service skills to assist TSA officers in airport screening operations. We are looking for candidates who can maintain a professional demeanor, who are team players, and have a positive and “can do” attitude. The Customer Service Agent will work in accordance with all TSA screening regulations while enforcing Operational Security at the Newark Liberty International Airport. Ideal applicants will have a positive attitude and a passion for customer service.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Provide assistance in the monitoring and flow of individuals through security check lane(s) to reduce wait times as much as possible, adjust passenger traffic as necessary to ensure consistent and smooth flow of traffic.
* Ensure security check points are properly supplied with an appropriate supply of bins and organized to ensure a smooth flow of passenger traffic for screening operations.
* Provide information and assistance to passengers placing items into storage bins.
* Complete logs, forms, and other paperwork applicable to assigned duties.
* Take appropriate steps to ensure all safety requirements are adhered to and suggests safety improvements as appropriate.


Requirements:
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Excellent Customer Service Skills
* Multitasking is a must

**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods of standing
* Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds unassisted

**Part-Time position**

**Compensation:** $19.00 per hour

title: Baggage Service Agents
description:
Description:
**Omni-Serv** is in search of **Full-Time** Baggage Service Agents for Newark Liberty International Airport. We are looking for candidates who can maintain a professional demeanor, are team players, and have a positive and “can do” attitude. This position has a high customer service interface and will always require professionalism.

**Scope of Work:**  

As a baggage service agent, you will assist passengers with their luggage and oversize equipment by loading and unloading items to and from conveyor belts and loaders. In addition, you will be tasked with securing items left on baggage claim carousels.

**Other duties include:**

* Supervising the transportation of checked luggage.
* Assisting with transporting bags to and from designated areas, loading luggage and oversized items onto conveyor belt systems.
* Assign checked bags to the appropriate carousels in the baggage claim area.
* Managing and documenting instances of damaged or misplaced baggage, as well as load discrepancies.
* Notifying the appropriate personnel of equipment damage and malfunctions.
* Observe the airline's instructions regarding irregular operations, report suspicious activity.


Requirements:
* Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds unassisted.
* Must be able to effectively communicate with team members as well as airline passengers- excellent customer service skills are required for this role.
* Must pay close attention to details and have the able ability to learn all required systems.
* This position requires frequent lifting, bending, standing, and walking.

**Compensation:** $19.00 per hour, employer paid health insurance

title: Head of Product Security
description:
Company Description


MarketAxess is on a journey to digitally transform one of the world’s largest financial markets, enabling the shift from analog, phone-based trading to a fully electronic marketplace. Why does this matter? Because our platform makes trading fixed-income more accessible, ultimately improving transparency, efficiency, and competition in the marketplace. Changing the way an established industry transacts is no easy feat. There will be twists and turns, because no one’s ever done this before. But now, more than 2,000 clients around the world rely on our solutions, and that number is only expected to grow in the years ahead. We know where we’re going. How we get there is up to us. Join us and help Take Us There.

**The Role**



We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Head of Product Security to lead and manage our Product Security Organization. Reporting to the Chief Information Security Officer, the role is responsible for overseeing the Product Security for both software and hardware products that are delivered within the MarketAxess organization and to our business customers. The role is pivotal in ensuring the availability, performance, and security of the hardware and software products/solutions we produce internally here at MarketAxess as well as through partners. The individual will work closely with product development, engineering, compliance, and legal teams to create secure-by-design solutions, protect intellectual property, and safeguard against cyber threats.


**How You'll Help Take Us There**


* Develop and execute a comprehensive product security strategy aligned with business goals.
* Lead and manage a team of product security professionals, providing mentorship, guidance, and support in their day-to-day activities.
* Engage and collaborate with leaders and teams across infrastructure, engineering, operations, product development and legal to integrate trust and security principles throughout the product lifecycle.
* Drive a security-first mindset across the product and development organization.
* Develop, design, and implement secure cloud architectures the align with MarketAxess’ security and business objectives.
* Conduct thorough security assessments, threat modeling and risk analysis for new and existing products and operational technologies, identifying product vulnerabilities specific to software and hardware.
* Deliver and improve Product Security KPIs, which reflects the Security, Privacy, Availability and Recoverability posture across MarketAxess products and services.
* Work closely with product managers, engineers, and architects to embed security into the product lifecycle.
* Champion secure coding practices, vulnerability management, and secure design principles.
* Oversee security reviews, code analysis, and penetration testing.
* Manage and mentor a team of product security. professionals.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, growth, and collaboration.
* Provide guidance on career development and skill enhancement.
* Communicate security risks, findings, and recommendations to executive leadership and relevant stakeholders.
* Collaborate with customer-facing teams to address security concerns and build customer trust.


**What We’re Looking for**


* Proven work experience as a product or application security engineer.
* 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity with a focus on product security, software security, or embedded systems.
* 5+ years of leadership experience in cybersecurity, including building and managing high-performing teams.
* Hands-on experience with security tools such as SAST, DAST, vulnerability scanners, and security testing frameworks.
* Experience with Agile and DevSecOps practices, integrating security into CI/CD pipelines.
* Deep understanding of the cloud security technologies and common toolsets.
* Strong knowledge of cryptography, authentication, access control, and other key security principles. \\
* Ability to execute in complex and dynamic environments.
* Strategic thinker with a passion for security and an ability to drive product security initiatives.
* Strong leadership and people management skills.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
* Collaborative mindset and ability to influence across departments.
* Proven track record in a fast-paced agile environment.
* Ability to explain complex security topics to non-technical audiences.


**What You Can Expect from Us**


* Hybrid Environment: Our employees enjoy a mix of working in the office and from home
* Free Food: We provide free lunch for employees when they are working in the office. Plus, our offices are stocked with snacks
* Paid Time Off: Competitive PTO package including vacation and personal days, sick leave and charity days
* Generous Parental Leave: Up to 20 weeks fully paid leave
* 401(k): Dollar-for-dollar employer match up to $17,500
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Employees can purchase MarketAxess common stock at a discount
* Wellness Stipend: We provide employees with up to $1K annually towards gym memberships, home office equipment and more
* Onsite Healthcare: We offer convenient access to world-class care through Mount Sinai at our Hudson Yards location
* Tuition Assistance and Professional Development: Benefit from live and on-demand learning, role-specific training, employee-led Lunch and Learns and guest speakers
* Core benefits: Highly competitive medical, dental, and vision programs


For job positions in NYC, NY, and other locations where required, the estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is $200,000 USD to $275,000 USD. Actual salary may vary depending on job-related factors, which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. You may also be eligible for annual cash incentives, equity, and other benefit programs.
